text: Okay place, good food, good prices, strip friendly location...what more can you ask for? Most of the food here can also be cooked lao style which is way better than the american-washed thai style stuff out there so go try it out....I go there all the time when im in vegas

good and tasty food.. but their soup is a bit salty! 
but their thai coffee is to die for! soooo goood and creamy!

Just moved into downtown, and ordered here after move-in day. When I walked in to carry out, the restaurant was full with a huge bachelorette party. Two women were belting out Lady Gaga over the karaoke machine, with the rest of the party singing along.  Be warned.

Ordered Tom Kha and Chicken larb. The larb was okay.  As for the former, the reviews below are right: something is up with the Tom Kha soup. There's an odd nuttiness--almost like peanut butter--in the soup that clashes with both the coconut and any heat in the soup.  More positively, the tofu in the soup was fine, and there were a good amount of mushrooms.  

Not sure I'll go back. Feeling scarred by the karaoke and confused by the Tom Kha.

In recent years ocha has become one of my favorite thai restaurant in vegas. What I love most about the food at ocha is CONSISTENCY, nomatter what time of the day you go and eat there, the food alwayse taste great! We alwayse order chicken lard na for our kids, they be tearing it up like no tomorrow haha. I've been to many thai restaurants in vegas and no one cook lard na the way ocha does. My personal favorite is GOY SEEN,  it's similar to larb but its raw beef marinated with different spices. A favorite dish of the thai issan people and lao people.

By far the best thai food in las vegas if you like spicy food the mint beef is amazing also the chicken sat Thai  is outstanding . also the owner is great person he takes so much pride in his food and the results show it. if you ever in Vegas or a local this spot should be rated 5 it's so good that I got my wedding caterer from this location!
This place is soooo good, food is very tasty if you like Thai cuisine this is the place to eat! Staff was extremely nice especially our server Sam!!
Food here is so awesome. The naked shrimp is one of the best things I ever tried. The host is super nice and the service is on point. What a gem!
I ordered for delivery and by far this is one of the best Thai i have tasted and the hot/spice level was perfect for the number i picked.  I will now be a frequent flyer!!!

First time eating here with my family. We ordered chkn tom kah, orange chkn, beef chow mein, red chkn curry, hawaiian rice, and kung pow chkn...all was great. Too bad we are not from the state otherwise we'd come here often. We will definitely eat here again when we visit. Food and service was great!!!
Great food and quick delivery.  You can't ask for more.  The delivery was actually early.  I will definitely order from them again.

Great food , awesome staff very friendly.  We came here to try the seafood soup and it was delicious and have been coming back ever since. Shout out to Sam (waiter) very funny never fails to make you laugh. Highly recommend. The food will keep you coming back.

Every time I order from you guys I specifically wanted a certain way and I give you guys a benefit of the doubt every single time I hope they get it right but still you guys don't get a right to top that when i to tell you I want it hot I want it hot not mild not medium but spicy HOT. On top of that I long piece of black hair in my soup.

A lovely place, and really great for late night eats as they're open until 11:30!

It's a great place to go, like our group of 6 did, when Fremont Street is way to busy, and you still haven't had supper yet late at night.

Portions seem large, so order less than one dish per person for a large group!

This place is definitely in the shadier side of town. Just on the other side of the parking lot is a motel, which has a wedding chapel and seems like the rooms get rented out by the hour. Also, as a hint to those who have a hard time finding it, the place doesn't seem to have lighted signs, which in stark contrast to all the places around it.

As for the food, we ordered the Thai Papaya Salad, Pad Thai with Beef, and Red Curry with Chicken (~$29 total) as take-out. I really was expecting mediocre or worse. However, it was better than I expected. Granted it wasn't the best I've ever tasted. But, it you're looking for some reasonably priced Thai food near the Strip, this is a good place to check out. General flavors were there. The papaya salad had good flavor and kick, though a bit on the soggy side, which might have been due to the time between cooking and consumption for take-out.
I really like the taste of the foods here, it's so fresh and great spices!!! I definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a nice tasty dinner. Good deals and good people
Every time that we came from California we like to get this fine great food. Highly recommend.

Not the greatest service or ambiance, but it's by far my favorite curry in town. Decent price for good sized portion, rice is always perfectly cooked. Awesome thai tea. Most items I've had here were good to great, never had anything I haven't liked so far.

Another excellent meal today at Ocha Thai, we've been eating at this establishment since they first started in 1989, my kids grew up enjoying the different tasty Thai dishes that we have come to love from this restaurant. The service has always been great especially our server Sunn who always checks to see that we are satisfied.  You will not be disappointed with anything that you order from their menu and you have an ample selection of drinks and beverages to choose from, what are you waiting for head down now or call in a pick-up order the food is delicious.
Super authentic as Thai food! Food is always hot and plates are full! My favorite Thai restaurant in all of Las Vegas.
Good food here!Well done for this dishe!!  Cry tiger !!! Delicious. But it's take time to cook for 15-20 minutes. It's ok for me, good food is always long cook.

I wouldn't say Ocha Cuisine has the best Thai food in Las Vegas, but I will say it's pretty darn good. The thing I like best about this restaurant is that it doesn't close until 4am and in the wee hours in the morning, they do have the best Thai food around.

The staff is friendly and courteous and anyplace that give me free refills on thai tea is alright with me!  The restaurant is clean and well lit. Also, it's in a good location. Not many seedy characters running around, aside from a prostitute or two walking the side walks of the strip, but they leave you alone.  :)

All kidding aside, I gave Ocha three stars, but really it's 3 1/2. The food is pretty dog gone good and a great place to hang out late at night.

I eat here about once a week for lunch.  The lunch specials are really good, very flavorful, and a great price for those that eat out a lot.  The egg drop soup is fantastic.  So is the meatball soup and beef soup.  The beef salad with a side of rice is a good lunch during the summer months.  I highly recommend this place.
Great consistent food. Each meal taste same as it did 10yrs ago. Same sized portions, same consistent service. Thumbs up! Thanks to the Xaypanya family!!

This authentic restaurant is definitely amazing killing. We order the Shrimp Tom Yum, Pad Thai, and the killer Drunken Noodle. All of that taste can be considered as quality and happiness. The service and the surroundings also amazing. Even the price is really" good for having that dishes. Above all, the manager also a really nice guy. Thumbs up

The atmosphere is great and the food was delicious. Me and my friends decided to try out this spot and we are satisfied. We got 3 different trays of food but for me, the Pad Thai is the best. I would definitely recommend this place.

Every time we come by to Vegas, I must stop here for Thai food. Their Thai coffee is one of the best ones I've had closest to what I've had in Thailand. Service was amazing.. food is as close to authentic as it can get. 

I brought my family who visited from Thailand here to have dinner last night. They really enjoyed the food and customer service we received. We ordered quite a bit... Tom Yum seafood soup, fish cake, papaya salad, shrimp fried rice, tiger steak (I think), chicken satay, and other various dishes with sticky rice. For a table of 10, nothing was left behind... we had a total of 10 dishes... maybe two of them were duplicates but nonetheless, clean dishes. 

Service was excellent and food was delicious.
Yummy food at a reasonable price. We were a little skeptical after reading reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised. Great Thai close to the strip. Great service too. We will return.

Ocha is strictly about what is on the plate- deliciousness! 

A quintessential example of " A hole in the wall, with amazing food."

Thai Beef Jerky is a must!
The food was amazing and appetizing. This place has an authentic taste. I would rate this 10 stars. Highly recommended to people who seek a Thai cuisine. And great service.
The food is good. Fish is fresh. The atmosphere is ok. Food taste look like real thai food. The service is normal. The restroom look old but it's clean.

I absolutely loved this place! In my short 3 day visit to Vegas I ate here twice. It was the most affordable meal for the amount of food we ate. We dined on so many dishes. Our bill was $80 for 5 people. I don't think the price is bad considering the location. The papaya salad with crab and beef jerky were my favorite and of course you can't enjoy papaya salad without sticky rice. The most authentic Thai/Laos style food I have had in a resturant. I will visit this place each and every time I visit Las Vegas. Oh, and they delivered to our hotel!

I was skeptical at first. I really wasn't sure what to expect from the place. I ordered red curry with shrimp spicy and my wife had green curry with shrimp and we shared Hawaiian fried rice. It's been two days since we were there and I'm craving my curry. The price was reasonable and the service was great. Both of our curry had more than enough shrimp and good flavor. The fried rice was excellent and even better the next day. We'll definitely going back.

FOOD= authentic , delicious
STAFF= friendly & attentive 
PRICE= Average 




Favorite Thai restaurant in Vegas, this is as authentic as you can get (grandma in the kitchen cooking). 

Thai Papaya salad is amazing here I have actually been there while the aunt or mom was cutting the papaya by hand ! 

Tom Kha soup is delicious & Pad Kee Mow make sure you specify the level of heat you desire. Restaurant just moved to newer location and on weekends they have karaoke. Fun staff and great food close to Stratosphere, must try while in Vegas.
Awesome service. Awesome food, the Cornish game hen is the best I've ever had by far.. The manager is really cool and this place is way underestimated. A+!
Great service and excellent food. Definitely should put on your list of places to try!

We went there for to-go order during our vacation in Vegas. We ordered chicken fried rice, Hawaiian fried rice, pad-Thai and basil pork. They were all really good; much better than the food we found at the hotel's food court. 
The guy that helped taking my order was very helpful. Overall, we was very pleased; we will come back there whenever we are in Vegas.

It's cheap, it's delicious and it's open til 5 am.

Sticky rice = delicious.

Really yummy Coconut soup.  

Pad Thai is delicious, so is the Pineapple Fried Rice.

If you're looking for a dinner that won't cost you $50 like most places in Vegas, go here.

Fabulous! This was actually my first time trying Thai food, and I loved it. Can't wait to go back! 

The inside of the restaurant is bigger than it looks from the street, and very welcoming. The service was phenomenal, we weren't sure what to get and they are so friendly! We tried so many dishes, and they just kept getting better and better. The food is absolutely delicious, and we stuffed our faces. The leftovers the next day (and next day) were awesome. We couldn't believe how much food we got, their prices are amazing. Highly recommend!!

For good oily food, this is the place that serves delicious dishes.

Whenever I go to Las Vegas and sick of buffets, I come here for good Thai food.  

All their dishes are good.  I love their Coconut chicken soup, "tom-kha-gai, it is soooo good that goes really well with "kai-jew", egg omelette dish.

nice food but not the serving. still not expensive 
we would prefer actual forks and knives

The first thing I ever got here was the tom yum when I was sick. I am sad to say I really was unimpressed with the soup. There was lots of cabbage and too many of the strong-flavored mushrooms. Not very much lemongrass flavor.

A different time I ordered the pad thai, I was reluctant because of the soup but it is the closest restaurant to where I live. Glad to say the pad thai was much better, not a lot of vegetables though but good flavor.
I will average my two experiences and give them 3 stars.
Yum!!  Feel like I unlocked a Vegas secret. Great Pad Tai and awesome Tom Yum soup. I love a good dive with great food!

Ordered to go which was a mistake , took almost 2 hrs to be delivered and when we called to check on the food the person was impatient & rude.  Food was cold when it arrived and it wasn't even that great! The pad thai was dry tasting and it really didn't taste like pad thai, their egg roll was hard . The only good thing was their papaya salad ,but how can you mess that one up!
Best Thai place in town! They have the best papaya salad and the best Thai beef jerky been coming here my whole life !
Had an excellent experience at Ocha Thai Cuisine.  The food was 5 stars and service was amazing.  We had the stuffed chicken wings which were fabulous.
Awesome Beef Pepper Steak, served with perfectly cooked rice. I always order from here because no matter what I order, it always arrives quickly and steaming hot and very delicious.

Good: 
Food is great
Lunch is cheap
Plus 1 ice tea for free when check in
Restaurant design ok
Free parking

Neutral:
Customer service: 
Did applogized for the long wait
But meh,  barely saw them during the lunch(they were too busy) 
 
Bad: 
Food wait time - totally failed and not acceptable
Took me literally 30min to get my lunch noodle (wth) 
Saw someone walked out the restaurant becuase no one was able to serve her
Come on,  put more staff to work especially for lunch rush hour,  this ain't french food

*Biased Review* 
I know Thai food well. 

- Food: Very Authentic, good taste just like when I go to Thailand. Cant get better than that. Of course this is with some dishes, not everything or all the time. Depends on the chef probably. 

- Sanitation: Reminds me of Thailand as well...Dirty. Not American Standard. But they are downtown. But I go there for the food. I was street raised, so don't mind eating ghetto styles. 

- Atmosphere: Not really authentic, just a place, with tables, a TV and Chairs. What evs 

- Overall: When I visit, I make it my business to visit and get food. I take food home for my friends mom, who happens to know Thai flavors more than me, considering my friends Mother, Grand and Great Grandmother all once worked at the Royal Palace in Thailand as food preps. 

Trust, the food here is bomb if you are looking for full Thai Flavors.
Great food and great service! The price is reasonable too for Thai food. We'll be coming back for sure.
Highly satisfy with my experience. The food was delicious, and the service was just as great!! The restrooms were clean.

This Thai restaurant is absolutely amazing. The owner treated our corporate event to a fantastic time. The food was all delicious, the karaoke was a blast, and it's in a convenient location on the north end of the strip.

Great Thai food! Love the spicy hot and sour soup and Thai salads. They will make it super spicy for you and not question our request. Definitely will return and recommend this restaurant to Thai food lovers.

surprisingly this restaurant is on the strip, but its not boojie at all.  its actually located in a less ritzy area of the strip right across from the stratosphere.  its been one of my favorite holes in vegas for almost ten years.  i always recommend my friends to go there.  yeah, most thai restaurants have the same menu and this place has really good food all around.  but at this restaurant  the things to order are the jerky appetizer and the papaya salad.  the beef jerky has been sundried and then fried in oil.  its so sweet and so tender and so flavorful from one bite that you have to eat it with a lot of rice.  the green papaya salad is mixed  with fish sauce, garlic, and peppers.  you take a piece of cabbage and wrap some of the salad with a chunk of sweet rice for such a delightully crunchy, pungent, spicy bite.  i usually order just these two things.  but b/c of all the spice, i need to tame it down and quench my thirst with the thai ice tea, but this place has a secret size thats not on the menu.  just ask for the big thai ice tea, and they bring you out a huge soup bowl for takeout filled with that creamy sweet burnt orange (UT-Austin)  colored tea.  also, if you are looking for a nice romantic dinner, this is not the place.  its plain white and loud from the karaoke.

Pleasantly surprised! This place has the BEST thai food in the whole Las Vegas valley, I have lived here for 16 years and tried numerous thai food places and this by far is the best. I love their fried rice, pad thai, soup & curry! YUMMY!

Great little place!  The waiter was amazing and took great care of us! He wasn't annoyed with "out of towners" and was happy to talk with us about more than the menu. Food was awesome too! It's off the beaten path but so worth the trip! They have karaoke one night and were bummed we missed it.

Thai food here is a hit. Every time we come the staff is so welcoming and friendly. My favorite dishes are the Chinese broccoli with crispy pork and chicken Larb. Tom yum soup is also wonderful. Check this place out!

I found the Ocha Cuisine just OK. I ordered chicken fried rice, beef jerky, chicken pad thai, and cashew chicken. All of the chicken dishes used dark meat whick was ok, I was just expecting white meat. I ordered the cashew chicken without peppers and it came with peppers. The pad thai noodles looked like spaghetti noodles but the taste was ok. I would not return.
This place was intro to me and yes its a hole in the wall if you like great thai..try this place its addicting

This is best Thai foods & authentic. We were greeted by friendly staffs. Great customer services. We went there during lunch special. The prices were reasonable under $20 for 2 of us.  I have to say I don't like the atmosphere. Also, the music was too loud.

I've brought a lot of my family, friends and clients from out of town. From Florida, Minnesota, Hawaii, Illinois and Louisiana. We all enjoyed the most amazing Thai dishes. From the Tom Kha gai coconut chili shrimp soup with mushrooms, the pork jerky with sauce, the pad see-ew, mint chicken, fried rice, papaya salad and many more amazing I can not pronounce Authentic Thai dish we had was delicious. On top of the Best customer service, they served a delicious ice cream on a pastry dessert that had a birthday candle and the servers singing happy birthday for my friend from Florida. We had a live musician entertainment that played all the perfect music. Every time I brought someone here, the best food and best customer service from Note and his team in the best atmosphere. I'll be back with more customers for sure. Thank you!

Economical, tasty, and right on the strip near the stratosphere. One word of caution, I asked for spicy and got quite a bit of spice. My curry had lots of habanero, serrano and jalapeno peppers and seeds in it. Err on the side of caution when they ask you how spicy you'd like your dish.

I use to go here all the time, and recently went back with my girlfriend. I always loved the pad thai noodles and really liked the fact they'll use tofu in it instead of animal products if requested. 
This last time we went, we tried the squid salad and even though my girlfriend was hesitant about trying it, she ended up liking it.
It's located right next to a hotel named "Fun City" which I always joke about because if you're staying there, it doesn't look like you'll be having much fun. The sign is breaking down and everything. Although it might be fun depending on what kind of "service" the crack whore you pick up around the corner gives you. Although I have a feeling you'll be driving down to "STD Clinic Street" right past "Gonorrhea Avenue" if you decide to do that...
So, the surrounding area around the restaurant isn't the best looking, but the food is great, the service is not bad, and it's inexpensive as well :)

First of all, we ordered the large Thai Teas to start with; the big foam cups filled up with 2/3 of ice and 1/3 of tea & milk.  It tasted like iced sugar water, can't taste of Thai tea.
Secondary, one of the dishes that we ordered from the picture menu did not match with the menu!  
Last but not least, the price on our bill did not match with the menu!  The bill's price was $4 more than on the menu!  
When we talked to the owner, he explained many excuses and insisted not to change the price on our bill.
Although we tipped them 20% on the bill at the end, we will never come back to this restaurant.

Horrible service our order takeout food got all the way home got the wrong food order called back the staff was horribly rude talk bad to me about me not ordering the right food and a mystical my order I do not recommend this place for anyone to spend their money they're only going to take your money give you the wrong order and on top of that my food was burnt

I went to las vegas for business trip and I want to eat noodle . I ordered a beef noodle,but the taste is awful with the small bowl and plenty of noodle. The store should serve such a noodle with a lager bowl and the service is poor.

Rounding up from 3.5 stars.  Was starving around 1:30 pm and looked to Yelp for a lunch recommendation.  Ubered to Ocha from my strip hotel.  Planned to walk back to my hotel but the area is really iffy so decided that might not be a great idea.  Uber back it will be.

Ocha is lacking atmosphere and I was immediately greeted with my pet peeve of a blasting large screen T.V.  This is definitely not a fine dining establishment.  Service was fine, no complaints, nothing fantastic either.

I ordered the chicken chow mein lunch specials for $6.95.  I heard my lunch sizzling in the kitchen and I knew it would be good.  Their version of chicken chow mein reminded me of a Chinese chicken and vegetables in a light brown sauce.  It was served with rice and a pile of yummy lo mein type noodles.  Plenty of fresh vegetables and chicken.  No skimping on the protein, even at the great lunch special price.  My entree was truly outstanding.  Very well flavored and cooked.

The lunch special was served with a spring roll.  The spring roll was cold but still good and an egg drop soup that wasn't much one way or the other.

Overall I'm a bit conflicted with this place.  The food is really good but the overall atmosphere leaves a lot to be desired.  I tend to go for the more elegant places but sometimes you just want a quickie and a beer, right?
Best beef jerky in town!!! One of a kind. Family owned business for years. Great service. Always updsting the environment. Give it a try!!
My wife and I had delicious, fresh chicken soup. The portion was large but not overwhelming. It's a real mystery why the place is not packed.

We had a very disappointing experience. After reading all these reviews I was looking forward to give this place a try. The pad thai was the worst we have ever had. I can't even describe the taste. The only good thing about our meal was the Thai ice tea and the sticky rice. It wasn't special but it was as good as you would expect it from any other Thai place.
I had lil doubt about this place but boi was I wrong the food and service was amazing and can't beat the price and portions!! Will be back soon for seconds and thirds lol.
Great legit Thai food.  The penang curry is outstanding.  Great friendly service.   I will return

2 1/2 stars. The food is just okay. Staff was nice.  We had Pad See Eu Chicken and the Tom Yum. Silverware is from 1970's bent and used on the drains it looks like. Tip of the day Costco on MLK up the street, sells new silverware at a reasonable price for restaurants. Needs some cleaning as well, dust off all the wine bottles and the shelves inside the restaurant full of dust. Clean and or remove the fish tanks. Maybe it's just us but we like a much cleaner restaurant. We will not be going back much better Thai restaurants in Vegas. I approve this message J K KUHL.

Im giving it a 4 because our server was great but food wise its 2, not really good.

We had 5 different menus and the only one we liked was the pad thai. The food tasted old and lacks flavor. I wouldnt be surprised since they served it pretty quick, so most likely they have reheated it over and over again. had been to different thai restaurants and this is my least favorite 

Not coming back. But i hope all server will be that kind of server, caters to customers needs
I have been coming here for years. Never changes. Great customer service. Very delicious.  Always fresh and yummy.
We like adding the chili sauces on Pad Thai  (also tried Thai whiskey for the first time and it paired really well with the Kirin beer )

Great restaurant. My partner and I recently went for lunch.  Service was great and food was awesome. My new favorite Thai restaurant. Great prices and high quality food. The red curry was great -- not too thick and lots of flavor.  Partner had minced chicken with mint, which was excellent. Very generous with chicken.  Overall, portions were generous.
five star meal all the way. The service is fantastic, all family run restaurant, food is awesome, almost every dish was a 10. Very fair corkage policy!

A beef pad thai that was sick...eningly good. I had the pleasure of tasting the "street" essence of the fried and soy sauce style attributed to asian wok noodles. I loved how my order came out in 5mins but tasted like it had taken 5000 years of culinary experimentation to master. The juicy AND crunchy beansprouts by the side served as a great palette cleanser, to reignite the noodle's taste after every 1 to 2 mouthfuls. Licious.

Don't let the fact that it's located in a motel parking lot turn you away.

This place was awesome. The food was incredible and cheap, the service was so nice and we have now made this a go-to place.

Its not a busy place as its closer to stratosphere.

Pad Kee Mow was tasty and cooked exactly as I like it - spicy
Very good place to eat! The pad thai was delicious and fried rice with chicken too!! Everything is very cheap and all the waitress very friendly.

It was my first time trying Ocha Thai Cuisine and won't be my last. Food here was fresh and delicious as well as the service was attentive and courteous. The Laos Papaya Salad was the bomb it's so authentic and tasty probably the best in town! My new favourite place to eat from now on.

We were looking for an authentic place in vegas after a week on the strip.  We found this place on YELP.  Pulled up and my daughters and I both thought the parking lot was sketchy at best.  We walked in and were more concerned.  Decided to stay and give it a shot...thank goodness we did!  The gentleman who sat us  was very helpful, explained the dishes and was spot on with his recommendations.  Brought my wife and girls a thai tea and thai coffee, on the house so they could try them.  When my daughter just wanted soup, he said the order would be too much so he would just bring her an extra bowl and if she wanted more, he would get it.  Everything was delicious and we argued which was the best dish with my wife and I loving the pad thai and my son and daughter loving the chow mein.  Everyone loved the soup.  Turned out our waiter was the manager who was friendly, helpful and ensured we will be back next time we visit vegas.  Trust me, you may not be sure, but you do want to visit this place for dinner!  Awesome!

Being from LA I saw the OCHA sign. I'm glad we found this place. We had a little problem with the soup as it was too sour, but man service was amazing the owner Note took care of us and did everything he could to make it right. (Service we will never get in LA) I left full and happy. The Pad Thai was really good and I'll say next time I'm in Vegas I'll definitely be returning.

Very yummy!

We have eaten delivery from Ocha several times and its pretty good!

What I like about this place is that you can tell them light or zero oil and they will accommodate!

My fav items from her would be veggie Drunken Noodles spicy, Panag Curry veggie, tofu Pad Thai, and veggie fried rice with extra extra garlic!

We have only used them three times for delivery so I can not speak to if the place is nice.

They deliver VERY QUICKLY via EAT24 and they are always super nice upon arrival!

They do not have a set veggie menu so you will just have to type out your special requests on each menu item.

They have never let me down with my demanding requests. The veggies are always super crisp, nothing is overcooked and the items are very flavorful!

Next time we order I will take photos :D

A party of 9 late on a Saturday night, we chose this place.  A young lady greeted us with a smile and quickly sat us to our table.   We noticed they also had karaoke which made our eating experience even more memorable because they played some 80's and 90's RnB, that had us singing.  We ordered our usual dishes but also took the recommendations from the waiter.  He was very friendly and recommended other dishes that he thought we would enjoy.  

The Thai papaya salad was amazing!  It had a good heat to it and tasted very fresh.  Chicken panang curry was once of the best we had.  We had 4 noodle dishes, all were very tasty but the pad thai here is something I would order again.  I loved the noodles they used for the Pad Thai.  Fried catfish was deliciously spiced  with the right amount of heat.  Thai ice tea came in a larger cup than other restaurants which my daughter pointed out.  

I was worried with the amount of food we ordered, that it would take a long to come out.  I was wrong.  After placing our order and gathering the kids to wash their hands, the first dishes were coming in and the rest followed.  The staff always was ready to fill our cups with drinks and always checking in on us.  

Overall experience and food was amazing.  I would definitely come back in a heart beat.  If you are wanting good authentic food, quick service with a smile, you will not be disappointment with Ocha.

Second time here in my last two trips to Vegas....gotta go off the strip for good food people!!!! 

This place rocks. Been to a million Thai places and Ocha ranks near the top. Curry was great. Whole fried fish, also great. Chinese broccoli and crispy pork belly, perfect. As everyone previously mentioned the Thai beef jerky is a hit with a great dipping sauce. 

5 people/ 10 beers/6 entrees/$120 bucks. Better than droppin' $400 at some cheesy ass "Thai' place on the strip.

Wait staff was great as well; friendly and attentive. 

Not a fancy place. Don't be fooled by the decor. The food is solid.

I was glad to find a good Thai restaurant not far from the strip. The price is about average to any Asian restaurant.

You could never go wrong with traditional papaya salad and beef jerky which was really tasty! My husband and I were glad to have found to place to eat like we were at home, even though being miles away. 

Just be aware, this place IS very easy to miss if your not familar with the area, so be sure to keep your eyes peeled!

Super lecker Preis Leistung stimmt 
Waren jetzt zwei mal hier essen und zwei mal war es super bei uns
Great food and wait staff.  Nothing to complain about except the loud music provided by Ocha's full time karaoke singer.  Try not to sit in front of the sound system.

I wanted to check out the thai food in vegas because my friend said it was really good last time he was hear.  Unfortunately, I did not feel the same way about this place.  We ordered the thai beef jerky, papaya salad, and minced pork with basil.  The thai beef jerky was too tough.  I felt like i was gnawing at it for minutes.  The papaya salad wasn't fresh.  We only had one bite.  They told us they used anchovies and it makes it smell differently.  The minced pork with basil was ok but the pork was fat.

After trying the terrible food and  over prices lotus of siam( which i will never go back...) iw as hesitant to try another thai place, this place IS awhole in the wall BUT the food is fresh . so give it a try you will like it

This is some of the best Thai food I've ever had and I live in a West coast city with great Thai food. Some dishes I've never had like the beef jerky were amazing and the atmosphere was so much fun. I  plan to be back here next time I'm in town absolutely. Staff was so dedicated and genuine. Give this place a try, you won't regret it.

Best tom yum shrimp soup in Vegas hands down
Everything in the menu taste very good 
Prices are cheap for being by the strip and down town
Best Thai I've found in downtown Las Vegas. The chicken fried rice is probably one of the best I've ever had.
Ordered delivery again because they are fast, great prices, and the food is really good. I'm going to keep ordering from them

Although a little bit on the pricey side (imo) it is the closest Asian joint to our new home so we had to give a go. I will admit everything we tried was very good.  The inside was very spacious. The decor felt like a typical Thai restaurant.
Ordered the lunch special the chicken pad Thai. It wasn't that great I couldn't finish the noodles. But I like that it came with an egg roll and steamed rice.

We found this place for a late lunch, the ambience isn't great. We were promptly seated and our orders were taken.

They offered to do a padthai (spice level-7) with veggies for my wife who is vegetarian. We also ordered the thai iced tea ,spring rolls and chicken fried rice spice level-8.

Our Food arrived shortly and tasted good. Portions are big as well.

Would recommend this place, if you dont care much for ambience.Their service is great.

Food was delicious but the place is pretty creepy. Once you get in they have tables and chairs that they don't use on the left side. Some old decoration on the right. The restaurant is big but with a dark atmosphere. They have an stage and nightclub lights. We ordered pad Thai and it was delicious, but I probably won't come there because of the atmosphere. Service was ok.

Ocha used to have good food but something changed and now its one of the worst.  Location was always sketchy but the food was good enough to make up for it, until now.  The food is sub par and the service is so so.
Update:  we drove by Ocha today and the health department has closed them down.  Hopefully they can return to the Ocha we used to know.

We usually try to eat here whenever we visit from SoCal. I always get the spicy noodles (vegetarian), it is not on the menu, but they will make it and they never disappoint.  Beware, their 5 is pretty spicy!

This place is amazing, my wife and I frequently order from here, the food is always phenomenal, the delivery person is always nice and the food is hot when we get it. It is also a great place to sit down and eat as well. We refuse to order or go to any other Thai restaurant.

Hands down. Best Thai food in Vegas! It's worth the drive or taking an Uber to come here although it is off the strip (3 min drive north of Stratosphere). My favorite is their Cornish game hen. For $8.95 you can't beat the value and taste. Sunan & Naiee are best waitresses in town. They're very friendly and even throw in free thai ice tea with Yelp check in. Highly recommended.
I like this place it close to work. Food is pretty good and they have lunch specials ... You might have to wait a bit to get your order. Overall not too bad.

I really enjoyed this place. The location was very iffy, right next to a Super 8 across from the Stratosphere in the middle of a slew of wedding chapels. The restaurant is actually very spacious and clean. When we walked in, we were promptly greeted and pointed in a general direction of several tables. I chose the one with all of the condiments already there. The server was friendly and accommodating. We made small talk and he offered a couple of suggestions. My friend opted for a combination chow mein and I opted for octopus salad. Both of the dishes were excptionally delicious and fresh. The chow mein meats were not dripping with grease as they tend to at many different places, and the octopus salad featured an array of fresh vegetables and crisp citrus flavor. Initially I thought the prices were on the high side, $10+ for most dishes, but when I saw how large the portions were, I could definitely justify paying for it. Their Thai Tea was also very good. I will be back to sample more of their extensive menu.
Had Tom yum soup with tofu instead of shrimp, absolutely delicious! Open til 4 am :)

Fooled by the reviews! 

The Mongolian tasted like Lemon Pledge and the Beef Jerky was just bad. 

Maybe I caught them on an off cleaning night?

We love Ocha! We Dine there at least a few times a month.  We always order beef jerky with the amazing chili sauce on the side! The Cornish fried hen is really good. I believe that it was either a management change or something because they started revamping the interior and none of the prior servers are there any more. Although I got to know the previous ones very well the new employees are just as nice.
Food here is great, taste extremely well and it's so traditional. The prices are inexpensive and the customer service is great

This is a must visit if you want delicious Thai food and friendly service. My friend and I were spending a few days enjoying Vegas and found this gem. We enjoyed the Pad Thai and Drunken Noodles. We got to meet the attentive staff that added to the amazing experience. That would be: Sunan, James, and Honey Bee. You must give this place a try. You won't be disappointed. Recommended!!!
The food here is so delicious! Ordered tom yum soup, pad Thai and garlic chicken. Truly one of the best soups we have had. The service here is prompt and very nice. A must try!!!

Ocha is across the Stratosphere, in front of some motel.  I come here everytime when in town.  Love it so much that I went two days in a row during my last trip to Vegas.  Ocha isn't the best in décor but the Laotian/Thai  food is great. Beef jerky and tomato chili sauce is my favorite...Yummy with sticky rice. The pad thai is good and larb gai is also tasteful. The papaya salad and sukiyaki are alright, had better.  The pho (beef noodle soup) is delicious, no need for extra condiments. They also have the bamboo salad but I didn't get to try.  I will definitely try it next time.  Can't beat great food at inexpensive prices.

SALVATION FROM VEGAS BUFFETS AND OVERPRICED EATERIES!!!!

After a hard day of riding (scooters), we dialed up this place on the Yelp app and decided to give it a go.

I ordered the Thai beef jerky (awesome!) and the beef Pad Kee Mao (not on the menu, but most true Thai places know how to make it...plus it was hilarious to hear the cook yell, "PAD KEE MAO!!!!!" in the kitchen).    As to why such a fantastic dish as the Pad Kee Mao was and still wasn't on the menu (as far as I could see), I'll never understand.

Anyway, huge portions, great food, good prices, def worth the short cab (or scooter) ride up the strip for when your looking for something more than fancy microwaved dishes with some Food Network chef's name attached to them or feeding troth buffet that litter the Vegas strip.

The good:
+ friendly, attentive staff
+ took special orders (PAD KEE MAO!)
+ great quantity and taste for the money

The not-so-good:
- a little ways north of most of the major casinos on the LVS
- sign is hard to see at night, as it is lost against the barrage of other signs it must compete with

My worst Thai food experience ever!!.  The food they served was luke warm, the beef in the fried rice looked old , my suspicions came true because after lunch the kids had upset stomachs.  The lady who runs the place never looked us in the eye which I thought was wierd.  This place needs a hygiene inspection  and I suspect will be shut down.  Really bad experience.  Don't ever risk going to Ocha, Las Vegas has too many good restaurants.

Came here with the recommendation of Yelp.. This place is so mediocre, nothing special and expensive for what you get, small proportion, about $9-$10 per plate. Thai Noodle house is way better. I did like the fried catfish, they deboned the fish, wanted pork, only chicken Satay was available... It was good, but there shrimp fried rice was mushy and squid salad was OK... Overall.. OK but not the 4 stars it's currently rated

This place is GREAT.  After searching all over the casinos for a place to eat vegetarian, we stopped into Ocha.  This was the best Thai food I think I've ever had.  You have to try the soup that comes in this firey volcano looking server thingy.  The only reason this doesn't get 5 stars is because of the diner-like atmosphere, but I'll definitely be seeking this place out on my next trip to Vegas.  I think it was a really lucky find!

The location is great and the food was really good. I had the pad Thai and steak salad and Pam noodles. I will respell next time I eat there. The service was excellent and the Thai tea was very good. We had mango sticky rice for dessert and it was amazing. :) We shall be sure to return.
Absolutely LOVE, LOVE this place. Amazing food great service best Thai food I've ever had. Beef jerky is a must try. My fiancé and had our first date here and we continue to come here to eat. Love it
The food was amazing with a very affordable price. I'd be looking forward to eat there again! 0=)
The food is amazing and affordable. My favorite is the Won Sun Beef and the Papaya Salad.

I have never been able to eat Thai food in my entire life, without experiencing health issues. The owner served me a vegetable dish with the vegan mushroom sauce. It is also gluten free and msg free. Not only was it delicious, it did not give me any issues. I'm so excited to be able to eat Thai food!

The service here was excellent. There were 2 large groups the night we were there and we were one of them. 
The food was delivered promptly and it was hot and very savory. We ordered the Thai beef jerky with sticky rice and it was comparable to the ones I've had at my dear friends homes. The stuffed chicken wings were delectable and crunchy. The cucumber salad was even delicious and fresh!
The entree we ordered was fried pompano and it was crispy and flakey. The sauces were all very good. The mint chicken was extremely well spiced. 
The only gripe I had was that the place ran out of Thai tea. Just kind of strange on a Sunday night with reservations of 2 parties of 20 people.

If you are looking for an authentic Thai cuisine, Ochai is Las Vegas' best option-- hands down.  With a fun atmosphere and exceptional service, the full menu is definitely worth boasting about.  
Don't go Kosher for this meal, it's definitely worth the sin!

Our office frequently order from this place for lunch.  I finally decided to treat my family out and give them a try.  The waitress was nice and the ambience was alright.  We ordered 10 dishes for our family of six and were excited to try their foods.  15 minutes after placing our order, my children excitedly pointed out that the waitress has our foods, only to pass us up for a couple who came in after us.  They ordered the same common dishes (fried rice and Pad Thai), so no reason why they got theirs first.  Our foods finally arrived, but one plate at a time with few minutes in between.  To top off this poor experience, my son was still waiting for his order after everyone were full.  Ocha management:  the proper etiquette was to bring the entree at once, so everyone can eat together.
First time having mint chicken and it has changed my life!  Mango sticky rice to die for!

I live in Los Angeles (specifically Santa Monica) and it sooo hard to find authentic Thai and/or Lao food. I came to Vegas for my birthday weekend and my friend, who is Laotian also, loves coming here and now I do too! In my 4 day visit, I came to the restaurant twice. The papaya salad (Lao style with blue crab) is the best! That's exactly what we crave for. We also tried the chicken larb, sausage, fried meatballs, Chinese broccoli with pork, stir fry, etc and all the dishes have good authentic flavors. The customer service is excellent!! The ladies are very nice and friendly. They're very attentive and caring. I will definitely come back the next time I come to Vegas!!
Shrimp fried rice and Pad Thai was tasty and good. Tom Yum was watery but the Beef Panang Curry made up for it as it was creamy and delicious! I love the Thai Iced Tea with Milk too.

I have had better Thai food, true.

I have had cheaper food in Vegas, true.

I have not had cheaper food with a better quality to quantity to price ration than at Ocha, true!

Not the best food in this city but won't break your bank either! Be serious! You can't have $70-$200 meals all the time here! It only took me two days to realize that would kill us!

So, here you go. Yay! Reasonably priced quality food.
Wonderful food! Great staff! The owner and his team to care of our group the entire evening with tremendous hospitality. Looking forward to visiting every time we come to town.
I have been here 2 times and will b going there alot more. Nice and Clean, Staff is Awesome and the the Food is Ridiculously Good. Luv this place and highly recommend you all try it.

I have been coming to ochas for over 15 yrs. I've never not been greeted as we walked in. The young lady just sat us and did not even speak!These new owners probably should have kept on some of the old staff or train the new ones to know the menu at least. The young lady looked lost when I said shrimp papaya salad. Then continue to tell me something that was printed on the menu they did not have. So disappointed my go to authentic Thai restaurant is no more. Time to find a new Thai restaurant so disappointed!

I ordered Ocha on Uber Eats. Not only was my order fresh and hot but it was delivered in less than 30 minutes of ordering. I had their beef pad Thai with tofu. I ordered it "hot" and it wasn't too spicy. I would rate their "hot" similar to a level 7 at other restaurants. They include the chili sauce in the bag too if you want to make it more spicy! Definitely recommend.

Awesome people! Great food! 
I walk in ask for table for 1and the waitress was very friendly with the big smile on their faces (first impression). As i look around i notice it was packed, waiter told me it'll take a few mins for me to get a table. Then came the other waitress said to me that my table was ready (fast). So as soon as i got to my table i ask if i can order, she said 'im sorry sir ill be back with you sir, theres another customers who came in before you sir ( i didnt really like what i was hearing but it was honesty. And they were right first come first surve. So i didnt mind.) Finally the waitress reach my table ( and it wasnt even 5 mins after she told me to wait to order my food by the way.) Then she took my order and it was on my table before i know it! It was alot faster then i thought! With all the being said, i love this place! Food was amazing! Service was awesome! The owner Note was nice and friendly. Theyre all friendly! And that is why i rate this restaurant a 5 stars restaurant bcus they deserve it! 
Best first impression!
Food was fast and amazing!
Friendly peoples!
Great service!
My favorite Thai restaurant. They have the best Thai beef jerky. The owner Note was very welcoming. Can't wait to try out their new happy hour.

Decent food, but terrible service. A few minutes after we sat down, a waitress came by to see if we were ready and we told her that we were. She simply walked away while mumbling something that we couldn't understand. Then, a couple min later, a waiter stops by to take our order...not sure what ever happened to the waitress that had originally come by. 

Our food came out fairly quickly and it was decent, but nothing special. I had the chicken pad thai lunch special which comes with an egg roll and rice. Thought it was kind of odd to serve rice with pad thai but whatever. My co-worker had wonton soup and chicken satay, both of which he says were bland. 

After getting our food, we never saw the waiter again until we were done eating and he came by to pick up our plates and refill our water. This was during the lunch hour, but the restaurant was not busy at all...There were probably only about 4 or 5 other tables occupied at the time. All in all, it was an ok experience, but there was definitely something off about the wait staff. I think I'll stick with something else next time around.
Everything was so good!!! Fresh and taste.  Must try beef jerky, cat fish and soup!!!

BEST Thai food in Vegas. Seriously. 

Naked Shrimp: basically shrimp sashimi but with delicious, spicy jalapeño sauce thats so refreshing at the same time! Just thinking about this makes me want to go back (and want to grab a gallon of water, if you are not a fan of heat ask for less spicy)

Tom Yum soup with shrimp: perfect balance of the sourness from the citrus - the large is plenty, shared amongst 4 persons and we all got a nice big bowl each, so delicious. 

Thai beef jerky: my god, this is bursting with flavor. I have had thai beef jerky in many places but this place blew everyone else's out the water!! And trust me, I honestly live in a very diverse asian area in Los Angeles - this place seriously hands down, best thai jerky. 

Pat See Ew: the chicken was charred to perfection, and the noodle's consistency was amazing. This was actually one of my coworker's favorite dish 

Honestly trust me when I say, this is seriously a hole in the wall in Vegas - make the stop here, you would not regret it.

This is my go to place for Laap Guy, & Koy Teo! I grew up in Thailand, & I've yet to find the flavors of Siam that come close to a few dishes that Ocha makes.
The Laap- Far & away the best! Get some sticky rice & cabbage, & do it lettuce wrap style. 
Koy Teo Nam-The Thai noodle soup is as close to a Bangkok street vendor as it can be. Highly recommended.

Horrible. I ordered 3 different soups like all tasted like water. The Tom Yum soup was the biggest joke. Tasted like slightly spicy water. The chow mein is the cheap kind you get at fast food Chinese places. The only decent thing we got was the beef jerky. I was craving spicy Asian soup today and am incredibly disappointed by this place.
The food and service was amazing. Everything we ordered, beef jerky, egg rolls, curry, broccoli was amazing. I will return. The Tom  Yum Soup was the best thing ever
The best Thai food I have ever had in the Vegas area.  Service is just as amazing as the food.  I've been coming here for years and it is always excellent.

My mouth pretty much waters up and I get that Homer Simpson donut trance look when someone mentions Thai Food.  I normally go to Thai House on the South side because it's close to where I live.  I went to Ocha for lunch one time based on a few tips from several people.  I also came to Yelp for further confirmation. I had the Tom Kha and after I finished my plate, I wanted another. I also had the staple/first timer of any Thai restaurant: The Pad Thai plate. To me both were richly flavored and balanced.  I've had Thai where there was too much fish sauce saltiness.  I would definately go back again...and again.....and again.  The pricing is not bad either.
Been coming here for years. Thai Beef Jerky is the BOMB!!!! Delicious definitely worth every penny. Do t forget the Thai Ice Tea too!!!!
Super delicious I did take out and it was really amazing they're stingy with their chili though haha

The service was great and very attentive. Food was amazing, Kung pao, pad se eew was on point! They have a stage with live music. Thai iced tea was
Bomb dot com! Def try this place!

I love this place! Its almost just as good as a home cooked meal. I grew up eating my mom's home cooked meal all my life and know when I've found a jewel. Don't let appearances fool you. We ordered 4 dishes and all 4 were delicious. If you don't want to be disappointed order...

1. Papaya salad (raw blue crabs if its available) 
2. Beef Jerky
3. Shrimp Tom Yum Soup
4. Fried Pompano with Chili Sauce. 

Bonus - They're open til 4am!!!

The food is really good, when you get your order right. The only reason I don't give them 2 stars is because the managers have worked with me in fixing my orders. But they have messed up my delivery orders about 4 times now, where items are missing, or the food is wrong. If your going to try this place I would suggest eating in seeing as they don't have their delivery system down yet

I haven't explored the menu here extensively, but I will say the Thai Fried rice here is my FAVORITE. And I definitely have my share of Thai food experiences around town. It's very flavorful and great as a meal on its own.
Love it here. The food is amazing. All the staff is very kind. Friday nights are karaoke nights and they're a blast! Great place for family night! I eat here very often and always am satisfied.

I'd rate it a ZERO if I could.  Sat down & was not even acknowledged. After 15 minutes I decided to leave. Waiters & waitresses saw us but never once came to our table. RUDE. OH! & the place smelled like shit & they couldn't even spell Fried rice correct in their menu. Steeeer Awayyyy.

Ocha is awesome.  Ocha taught me a lot of things - mainly how to drink, but we won't get into that here.  Ocha taught me about Thai food, basically.  

We went here one night about a decade ago because we heard tell that someone would let us sing karaoke.  So we showed up, and the entire restaurant was filled with Thai people.  Yes, there was karaoke, but there was also the opportunity to try some authentic Thai food that was obviously really good. I started trying all different things: pad thai, chicken satay, tom yum soup, thai fried shrimp, curries, etc.  All of it is great and has been consistently great for years.

It ain't fancy, and it ain't in a good neighborhood.  If you're trying to impress someone with a posh place, this isn't where to go.  But if you're trying to impress someone with good food, it ain't a bad choice at all.

I don't know if there's karaoke there anymore, but that's not really the point anymore, now is it?

Best Thai restaurant on the strip!  This place has the best employees. The owner came and introduced his self and he was very nice.  The Thai shrimp fried rice is my favorite dish!  It taste very fresh.  Please try out this place of
You're in the area

Really loud, really bad karaoke performer.
Everything costs more than online menu w/ menus that say prices can change w/out notice.
Pad Thai = Greasy pile of noodles w/ tough chunks of meat.
Red cat fish curry = inedibly old fish in flavorless greasy pool.
Service: the nicest thing I can say is it sucks.
First and last visit to this grossly overrated waste of time and money. Their actual prices are more than the consistently excellent Thai St. on Industrial, and just shy of the reigning champ, Lotus of Siam. Ocha doesn't need to exist.

Back at it Again! & it just keeps getting better 
Besides our usual faves (Chicken Pad Thai & Thai Beef Jerky), this time we decided to try out some new dishes... We tried Yumwoozen & crab lao style papaya salad & the Thai deep fried Catfish!! Everything was awesome! 

Thanks guys for the awesome food & great service!

We went here for lunch today, and had high hopes.  Unfortunately, I wouldn't say that Ocha is one of the better Thai restaurants in Vegas.  They seem to get a lot of business from tourists and businesses in the area.  So, why change to be authentic?  We ordered the tom kha khi, pad see ew (on the menu as something else), shrimp with pepper sauce, and beef panang.  

We liked the pad see ew the best.  Of course, this is a hard dish to mess up.  One thing that stood out was the quality of the chicken.  They gave us nice big chunks, and some of it was dark meet seemingly straight from the bone rather than thawed from a package of chicken meat.  The Chinese broccoli was also fresh, thick and lots of with stems.  The sauce was a little on the weaker side, and although the dish was good, this "weaker" attribute seemed to be the theme of the food here.

The tom kha khi was disappointing.  I even ordered it extra sour and medium spice, and it still came out bland.  There was no galanga or lemongrass chunks.  It had the floating spice that LoS and Komol are famous for.  Appearances don't fool the taste buds though.  The chicken was the only great part about this dish; again huge chunks that seemed to have been pulled off of a whole chicken.  

The beef panang was very sweet.  In fact, I don't think I have ever had a beef panang this sweet before.  I think that it could have been a decent panang if it weren't for this.  

Overall, I am giving Ocha a 3 star review because their ingredients are good, especially their meat. However, their style is definitely dumbed down for the average person.  This makes sense considering their location, but overall this was a disappointing experience for me.
I had they pad Thai, it was really good the size was perfect for 2 meals. The Thai tea was just too sweet.

I ate about here about 3 years ago and the food was good. It's at the end of the strip passed Wynn's hotel. A little out of the way if you're staying on the strip but well worth it. They had the best homemade dry beef jerky!!! I would come back here again when I visit Vegas again!

In a city filled with incredible Thai restaurants that provide excellent food & service, this place is at the bottom of the list!

Buyer beware! We were fed the old bait and switch and played for fools. On the menu cover, they write something along the lines about their pricing is subject to change at any time. Yeah, they take advantage of playing the price game and being dishonest with their customers. Also some of the menu items such as pompano say market price. Why?! Pompano is not in any way special or luxurious!  Shady. This place is a dump and overpriced for no reason.

The service was horrendous and a good indicator that the rest of the evening was going to fail miserably. 

Our waitress did not have any business working as a server at a restaurant, matter of fact, she didn't have any general training. Her superior was just as clueless and not a joy to interact with. We received half-assery all around.

Other than the break in communication, (which isn't a problem at all) we felt that our waitress used language as a barrier to withhold pertinent information about menu items and pricing. She played the dumb card. 

To summarize the betrayal: I ordered the $13 catfish in spicy sauce, she takes the order & the menus, goes back to the kitchen, then comes back up to tell me they ran out of the catfish and if I would like to swap it with the pompano fish? I was unsure at first, but she assured me it was the same exact dish, but with pompano fish instead. Fine, I decide to go for it. Little did I know, the pompano is doubled in price. It went from $13 to (market price) $26!!! She never disclosed this to me, at any time. It wasn't a swap, it was never a swap. She ordered the $26 pompano fish, which was not the $13 catfish in spicy sauce I had originally ordered. Highway robbery!

We went to dispute the charge and they said that's the price on the menu and thats what we agreed to order. That's funny!...she took the menu after I originally ordered the $13 catfish. She comes back to tell me they only have pompano if it's ok the swap the fish. Never showing me the menu again or disclosing it's doubled in price. Apparently I'm the idiot prisoner; apparently I needed to ask her if the price was the same or if it doubled?

That's so screwed up. The worst part was all the food we tried was all half ass, super basic. The beef in the panang curry and pad see ew were paper thin, overcooked, hard, dried out and chewy. We also tried the Thai beef jerky (which I would rather eat a slim-jim) sucked. Nothing wowed any of us.

I regret everything!

Came in for lunch on a Saturday. Not too many people there. The waiter was very attentive and offered suggestions when we had trouble deciding. Bonus points for memorizing our order and not writing it down. 
Service was quick, food was hot and it was tasty. 
Decor was pretty ugly, but no points lost there because my priority is how good the food tasted. 
One negative is finding a hair in the cucumber dish served with the chicken satay. I thoroughly checked everything else. 

Service and food is good.
Cleanliness.......needs to improved.

The food was outstanding and plentiful. We split two entrees and an appetizer, party of four. We sat outside and enjoyed the view and crowd that passes by. The food is really rich and the service was too notch, a great spot to enjoy lunch on the strip!!

First of all i dont understand why the reviews are so good here. The place is so big inside but so much wasted space, just junk and trash all over the place. The whole inside needs to be remodeled from floor to ceiling. This includes the bathroom. It does not even look like a resturant on the inside, booths have holes in the seats glass jars with corn and beans in it. My bad for not taking any pics sorry. Meun had food on them and sticky. I am a vegetarian and on this big menu they only had 4 vegetarian courses if you can call them that. We almost got up and just walked out but the waitress walked up so i asked her if they even had tofu available. She said they could do Pad Thai with tofu so i said sure so we stayed. I ordered at level 7 for spiciness because i like it spicy. When the food came out she brought some spice on the side said here add it your self maybe because i am white they didnt think i could handle spicy food. Plus no tofu on it so i asked the server what happen to the tofu she said i forgot so i was being nice just said bring it on the side. She comes back with this little bowl with 7 cold, hard and chewy most disgusting tofu I have ever ate in my life. So the dish had no flavor or spicy to it the tofu i couldnt even eat. This is the worse Thai so called restaurant i have ever been too. The only reason i would ever go back to this place is just to take pics for everyone to see how dirty and disgusting this place looks. I feel sorry if you are a vegetarian and eat here stay away.
This place has real Thai spice that does not disappoint. I even had food leftover because the servings are nice sizes. The stuffed chicken wings were great.  I will definitely be back to try more.
Great authentic Thai food, best in LV. Recommend the crispy pork and coconut Tom Yum especially. 5 stars.

The food was great.  The price was reasonable.  I did a delivery order and it arrived timely and hot.  I think there could have been more soy sauce, hot sauce, etc. in the bag. Other than that it was good experience.
All I can say is everything is so good and authentic if you are looking for the real Authencity of Laos thai food you age try here!

Went tonight - party of two.
Almost empty
Stage was set for karaoke which would have been fun! 
Clean restaurant . 
He ordered curry beef and steamed rice  with a side of egg rolls.
I ordered beef noodle soup and side of sticky rice.

Would rate a 1.5 if we could. 
Server was rushing but pleasant. 
Curry was edible but runny and the beef hadn't marinated in or cooked in it . Just thrown in at the last minute .
Steamed rice was fine- bland as expected
Egg rolls were horrible . Rated 1 out of 5

Beef noodle soup was so potent that i couldn't eat it . I'm accustomed to pho or Latin American flavored soups but this was totally diff - could've been exactly how it was supposed to taste but I don't know! To me, the aroma itself was nauseating. I didn't even eat one bite - tried the broth and couldn't stand it any more.
Sticky rice was good - steamed in the traditional woven bamboo-looking thing.

$26 total before our $10 restaurant.com coupon. We paid $16
Really nice workers.  Food was on point definitely would recommend this place.  Thanks again for the extra ice and hot water!

The food was amazing!  I had the beef curry and my friend had the chicken pad Thai!  The owner Note was so kind and gave us great service.  The dining area is very clean and nice atmosphere.  Already planning to return soon.

I had a party of of 10 last night for Mother's Day, as soon as we arrived we were seated. Service was fast and friendly. Food was amazing and price was great as well. I'm definitely going back! Great job!

Delicious authentic Thai food. 

Every time we come in we get what they call "the crying tiger". It's steak on a bed of lettuce that comes out with these 2 sauces. The sauces are the highlighters! This is why you cry when u eat this dish. Lol it is spicer then anything but it's also extra delicious so you just can't get enough of it! One sauce is red (my favorite) and one is green (burns your whole mouth). I honestly love spicy foods but the green sauce might just be my limit! 

The dish comes out with rice. I usually make like a little lettuce wrap with it. You can just dip the meat in the sauce and eat it with rice. Which ever way.. It's extra delicious. Also you can substitute the meat with chicken which is what my beau does because he's on a diet and can only eat chicken. But if you want chicken breast you have to call ahead and check if they have it because they don't always carry chicken breast. But either way it's still bomb.

I've also had the chicken Pad Thai which was amazing as well. I actually ate the whole dish by myself which NEVER happens! Lol 

The staff are really attentive and nice. They make sure they come and talk to us and converse. Waters are always full. And one time one of the species took over my throat and I was coughing up a storm and they Gave me a free Thai tea! Which actually helped with the heat. 

Love this place and usually come in once a week or once every other week!

I was looking for some kind of home cooked meals out of all bigger and finer restaurants we been to from last couple days in Vegas. Found this place on yelp, as expected, same great taste from an Ocha Restaurant in LA. Great food and good service. I ordered 3 dishes to takeout and didn't expect the free rice that came with it. Plus, a free thai tea when you check in here on Yelp. Thanks!

WARNING: If you order a level 5 spice, be prepared for level 10. Holy cow. If you want mild, be sure to get a 2 so you're not caught off guard like we were. Aside from our drunken noodles being so spicy, we had a hard time eating it, we also ordered the tofu ground pork soup. It was bland and they forgot the clear noodles that comes with it.

Fab little Thai place on Las Vegas blvd, great food and great value should be busier.. Don't be put off by the area, service was attentive will be coming back.. My husband says to mention we got a large pot of rice.. Lol

Omfg! One word.... Amazing! If you are looking for LEGIT Authentic Thai food, this is the place to go. Had Green Curry, Pad Thai and Larb... Deeeeelish! The prices are perfect. Not expensive at all. Thai tea was made to perfection! The restaurant was clean, had a beautiful big fish aquarium in the lobby. The staff were all nice, quick and efficient. Utensils, plates and glass were all clean and spotless. I could go on and on, bottom line, this is our new go-to place for Thai Cuisine!

You can tell from the waiting time that their food is just amazing! It's very flavorful and my panang curry had a great aroma. They added litchi, grounded peanuts and fresh basil which was a great blend! We ordered vegetable spring rolls and they were not as greasy as they usually are! I highly recommend the bar as well and 45 minutes wait time was worth!

The neighborhood may not be the greatest, but the food makes up for it. Very tasty!

I had the Pad Thai and asked them not to add any chili peppers or peanuts. It was really good and even hubby enjoyed it, even though he tells me he doesn't care for Thai food. He kept digging in for seconds, so I knew this dish changed his mind.

He ordered the Chicken Chow Mein and this was also delish! The dish portions were generous, so we were able to share both items and we enjoyed our Christmas lunch!

I also had the Thai Iced Tea and ohmygosh that was out of this world too! I nursed it so that I could enjoy it later...took it out with a to-go cup. YUM!!!!

Hubby said he would come back, which means he liked the food! Me too...we'll be baaaack!

I come to Ocha almost every time I visit Vegas! Tasty, good prices and great staff! They customize any order and are so friendly! Food is delicious. Definitely try their cornish game hen and curries! We especially love the waitresses, Gammie, Sunan and Naree!

We ordered lunch. 
Green curry and combustion fried rice. 
The green curry had no taste .
The fried rice has 2 shrimps only and the rest meat. 
Not happy at all 
We will not order from you anymore
Deffinately recommend mint chicken chopped up fine over white rice. Aside of tum yum is the topper.

Absolutely no customer service. I made a delivery order 2 hours before they close and after waiting an hour, I tried to call them and they did not answer and you couldn't even leave a message. I ended up ringing Grubhub and they couldn't contact them either. Grubhub ended up having to cancel my order and hopefully I get refunded in the next couple of days. This is just unacceptable for a restaurant to not even respond or have an answering machine. A one star is too high for this place. Extremely poor pathetic service!!!

Well. They don't close for another 50 minutes but they have most of the chairs up, they're mopping and counting cash. I was waiting to be seated, had been seen by 2 employees and no one greeted us. There were only 2 of us waiting and we were planning to eat something small but I guess it was too much of an inconvenience to seat us. We left and won't be returning.

Review #182 - 2016

I was sorely disappointed when I came back to have lunch at Ocha with my niece on August 25th.  This spot used to be my favorite Thai/Lao restaurant.

When we first walked in, I could pretty much tell that something had changed, but I didn't want to assume anything and just sat down any way.

The guy who sat us was rude and loud.  He was on the phone almost the entire time when we were dining in and I could hear everything he was saying, and this restaurant is pretty darn big.

We ordered my usual: beef salad, papaya salad and esarn sausage with sticky rice.

The beef salad was dry and flavorless, yet sour so it was hard to enjoy with our rice.

The papaya salad was also sour.

The only good thing were the sausages, but that comes from a package from a well known vendor so it tastes the same everywhere.

The waitress was the only reason why this place even got a 2-star.  She was very friendly and accommodating.  When I asked her if the place was under new management, she said yes and asked if the food was ok.  I told her the truth and she was very receptive of my complaints and said she would let the owner know.

Will I be back?  Most likely not...

Ive been going here for about 7 years occasionally I love their food but their portions have gone down in the past few years.

Id recommend this place as a nice sit down restaurant that also offers to go and they are also open late!! :D

I usually order Shrimp Pad Thai, Combination fried rice, and Tom Yum soup.

Their service is pretty good exept for this old lady with curly reddish brown hair who doesn't understand english that well, and she gives you attitude. And bad customer service skills.

Heres the story of my bad experience at ocha's 

Okay so i decided to take my cousins out to eat some good food because we were all hungry. So I decided to treat them to a nice dinner at Ochas. We get the the location of 2211 S. Las Vegas Blvd. and there's no resturant there. They relocated to 1201 S Las vegas Blvd. which is a short drive up the street. We get there and we get seated into a small table me and my cousins were bumping our elbows to each other every so often and our waitress is a older woman with curly reddish brown hair she has a strong accent and we struggled to communicate with her. She seemed to come off as a tad rude and grumpy.  I ordered four Shrimp pad thai's  a combination fried rice and four thai teas for our dinner, I wanted to take some food home so I told the lady that I was also going to order a combination fried rice to go, but not right now after we all finish our food I will order it. She nodded as if she understood and walked away. 

   The food took about 5-8 mins to come out which is average and not long at all we were happy because we were hungry :D.  As she was placing our food around the table she also brought with her a bag with  a container full of the combination fried rice. She placed it on the table and Walked away. I look at the box and said "excuse me," she kept walking away so I got up and walked to her with the bag and container of food and explained to her that I didn't want the combination fried rice right now that I was going to order it once we finished. She looked at me for a while as if she was annoyed and said, "well the food is already cooked," I responded with, "well I would like my food at the end after we finish eating," she took it and we went our ways me to my table and her to the counter behind the register.  I went back to my table and even asked my cousins, "didn't i tell her i wanted my to go order after we finish eating?" they responded with agreement and they also pointed out that she was giving me attitude. I like to give the benefit of a doubt but I also noticed the attitude. 

We begin eating and it taste soo good OMG so good D: ahhhh!!   :@ cant stop eating until the food is gone :c and our tummy's full xD

But we rushed through eating also because I figured the lady wouldn't remake the food that she mistakenly given us too early so it was just sitting there getting cold.  So we finished our food and it was really good. We got full and I got the bill it came out to around $60 bucks So i went up and payed And the lady reaches around the counter and gives me the bag with the container of rice she didnt remake it as a predicted. I left no tip that day but i usually tip at least 20%. 

I have gone there many times after this day and also ordered over the phone to pick up some food to go. I've had one problem with ordering on the phone.  The lady on the phone was rude and kept making me repeat the order and kept cutting me off when I was talking. But when i went to go pick up the food the same grumpy old lady with Curly reddish brown hair with the strong accent was there. And yet again I left no tip. 

ThIs place has the best shrimp pad thai and thai tea that I have ever eaten. That's one of the reasons i keep going back but I will avoid that One waitress lady from now on.

Hope this review helps some of your guys out there Thanks for reading.
Love it here!!! Soup - great! Broccoli and beef; great! Everything is sososososo goood!

Ocha is such an amazing place. I went there with my boyfriend today and we are always looking for amazing Thai food. Their food is definitely on point from textures to seasoning and spices. 

Customer service was extremely amazing. Fast and very attentive. Super polite too. 

The owner - Note took the time out of his busy schedule to talk to us and get to know us And asked us how the food was. He makes sure his customers are always satisfied. 
He is one of the most down to earth business owners I've met. 
5/5 stars would go back again.

Just left this place and had a very rude experience. I come in and order a combination pad Thai and the "owner" or whoever the guy is tells me something stupid about shrimp and told me he should make sure the shrimp was in my box. He said I had been there before even though it was my first time ever trying this place out. So my husband and I laugh it off as if he is playing mind you we have never seen this man before. So I get home and sure enough there is absolutely no shrimp in my food at all. I call and let them know there is no shrimp in my food and this same man very very rudely gets on the phone talking some nonsense of how I had been there before two weeks ago and complained about the shrimp not being in there. (Ohhh so this has happened before.) He claims he has me on video so I said ok I will come down there bring my food and you can show me the video. I get back there and he is being very rude saying he is not going to do this because I have been there before and I ask show me the video and he told me it would take hours ok why say it then. My thing is this establishment is not only rude but racist. Yes it could have been possible a woman who looks similar to me( meaning another black woman) came in and you did the same thing to her but what would be my reasoning if that was me to come back and order the same damn thing if it was a big problem the first time???? Seriously you deserve less than one star for your horrible customer service. Didn't even get to taste the food but after that I wouldn't even.

Galloping honeypots, Ocha Thai is a find![1] Their plain Jane interior may not impress, but their Thai and Chinese cooking will.

Considering Ocha is in the shadow of the Stratosphere, they might seem to be a bit of a dive, especially in comparison to other spots on the Strip. On the contrary, Ocha is clean, and their service wicked fast: we were seated, had our orders taken, and got our food before we could blink. For their speed, we never were rushed.

Everything was expertly prepared, from start to finish. We enjoyed their beef jerky appetizer ($8.95) - chunks of tender spiced beef brisket, sundried then deep-fried - as much as the sweet sauce that came on the side. Their chicken tom yum soup (8.95), flavored with mushrooms, lemongrass, chili and lime juice, helped ward off hunger.

For entrees, try their pad thai chicken (8.95), stir-fried with bean sprouts, and a lime on the side. It's slightly sweet, with a perfect, light texture. A few plates of combination (pork, chicken, beef) fried rice (9.95/plate) rounded off our meal nicely. (Somehow we ended up with sticky rice too, but I didn't try any.)

Recommended for a comfortable, affordable lunch.

[1] Thanks Vy for taking me here! Getting here was an adventure, but worth the effort.

Came here around 10pm after a long and hot day of coming to visit Las Vegas. Waited by the sign that said please wait to be seated for a few mins until someone noticed us and said we will be right there. Told them we had a party of 13 with 2 babies. Took them about 5 mins to get the table together. We sat down....and menus were passed out to us. The waitress then proceeded to ask if we know what we wanted to drink.
