Stated water all around for now, but ask where on the menu was the drinks listed. She then stated it was on the back of the menu and then left to get water for us. I kept looking on the menu for drinks and did not see a single drink item, so when the waitress came back I asked her again and she tried looking for it but it was no where to be found. Then stated they were new menus and probably forgot to print the drinks on there. So then I was like okay, can you at least tell me what you have, she kindly told me the drinks menu. Then I ordered a thai tea :)  then after we proceeded to order our food. Took awhile for food to come out but we did have a large order. When the food came out it smelt so yummy and I couldn't wait to eat. They did messed up one of my family members order, but took care of it right away. There was also a live performance that night, from one of the worker, she sang some great oldies. But anyways when the food all came out and we stated eating, the food was just okay. It didn't really hit the spot. I got the drunken noodles with beef spicy #6. But goodness it was spicy for a 6, but the good kind of spicy. Their fried rice was okay. Their thai sausages were a bit salty and oily. The hen chicken was really good though. Their thai tea is alright as well, nothing too special...and they didn't have boba. Overall service was ok and food was ok.

I have been coming here for years. For the price and the service, you can't do any better.  Met the new owner, Note, who was actually an original employee who purchased the restaurant from the previous owner.  The recipes are the same although the staff had changed. But the service and high standards remain the same. I highly recommend this local favorite.
Very clean, food is delicious, and great customer service. I was just told theyre getting new owners and the whole staff and menu will change.

The food here was oddly more Chinese than Thai, even though the decor is very Thai. We came across this place during a family trip to Vegas. My cheap ass father didn't realize that Vegas buffets cost at least $35/person, and so we left the strip and headed toward the more desolate end of Las Vegas Blvd.

I wasn't expecting much at all, but this place sure surprised me. I really liked their panang curry, and the service here was great.

Best of all was the Thai tea. Most delicious Thai tea I've ever had. Really. Apparently the best Thai tea ever exists in Vegas. Who would've thought?
Delicious food!!! We had chicken fried rice, kung pao chicken and veggie egg rolls we will definitely coming back every time we visit Las Vegas.

Ok, don't know what the haters were smoking but food here is really good and reasonable. My sister and I had the pad thai and it was plentiful and tasty. I think it's like that first drug experience but with Thai food. I'm still trying to replicate my first experience at Choo Chai in Lubbock and have eaten Thai across America and have yet to get the same rush. I will however be back the next time to try the curry.

It has been over 10 years since I last ate at this restaurant and the food was just as I remembered--amaze balls.  I always order the same dish whenever I go to a Thai restaurant: chicken larb that is medium spicy and a side of sticky rice.  I like my food to be spicy enough that it gives it flavor--not too mild where the kick isn't there and not too spicy that I can't enjoy the flavor of the whole dish.  They made it perfectly and just the way I like it.  I love me my chicken larb and this did not disappoint me.

I like this place, in my opinion the Pad Thai could've been more flavorful, the noodles were on the bland side. And the beef jerky everyone loves to me was very chewy and the beef flavor was too strong for my taste. However the fried rice and egg rolls were really good.

I had this place ordered through postmates when I tried it, and it was okay. I had the pad thai, and the noodles tasted more sweet than i personally like. I was also a little disappointed I was not given the option to order a spicy level. Cannot say I would order from here again.
I had the pad Thai tofu which is one of the best I've had in Vegas.  My wife had the chicken and rice soup.  She loved it.  Really can't understand the negative reviews!!!!

I was at Ocha on 12/11/16 and I cant say enough good things about this place! I was in the mood for Thai and this place was right across the street from the hostel I was staying in. the food was good and the customer service was top class. I had the curry pork and it was amazing. The waiter was very helpful and informative about the menu. I was pleasantly surprised with the service I was greeted with a smile, my glass was never empty, and I was sent off with a thank you and a smile. Honestly one of the best dinning experiences I have had in a long time! Come to find out after my meal that the waiter that took care of me was actually the owner you can tell has a passionate and loves what he does. Like I said before I cant say enough good things about this place I will recommend Ocha to anyone that wants good Thai food and great customer service!

Das thailändische Essen ist authentisch und auch der freundliche Service ist angenehm! Preis-Leistung stimmt ebenfalls. Das Restaurant ist etwas außerhalb gelegen, aber dafür muss man nicht nach Parkplätzen suchen.

OMG! If find yourself in Vegas and is craving Thai food, this is the place to be NO JOKE! The food is AMAZING! I eat Thai a lot. Out of all the Thai places I've been to this place BLOWS them out of the WATER! The noodles are full of flavor and not dry. The rice is cooked almost to perfection. Everything is just amazing. Taste buds will be JUMPING for JOY! To keep it simple...this place is BOMB!!! I don't think I can have Thai food anywhere ELSE! you will leave Vegas with a new memory! Don't miss out. Come and enjoy with friends and family. You will not REGRET IT!

Last time I was here I got the beef panang curry and it was delicious. Usually my go-to dish for Thai food is a curry dish but this time I ordered the lunch special kung pow beef; ($7.52 was the total amount) I was unfortunately disappointed and should of went what I had last time.

The dish was decent--bland and barely any beef--the portion didn't fill me up and left me hungry after a couple of hours. The dish came with a side of one egg roll and a small cup of sweet and sour for the dipping sauce so the egg rolls was pretty good.

I would give it two stars but the waiter was attentive and professional. He alone added the extra star.

So happy I was referred Ocha Thai Cuisine. This is a wonderful family owned Thai and Chinese food restaurant. The dishes are all cooked fresh , proper , and still delivered quickly. Most importantly they taste great! I have a few yummy items to recommend; first the chicken curry with rice. I went with the green curry which had a hint of mint and perfect amount of spices. There is also a red curry option. I also enjoyed the KungPao chicken which is cooked more Thai style than Chinese. Meaning more vegetables and a little increased pepper taste. The owner is super cool, he brought me some sticky rice because he heard I never tasted it before. That was awesome & really fun to dip in the sauce!

Best Thai jerky in vegas possibly the world!  I came here 4 years ago and ordered the Thai beef jerky.  4 years later I'm back and it's still one of the best Thai dishes I've ever eaten.  It's a little far off the strip but it's worth it

This place is found toward the end of the strip near the Stratosphere and although its not in the most glamourous part of Vegas, the food here is pretty good, and not overpriced at all like most restaurants here. It has more of an authentic taste than most places you'll find around here. The padthai and pineapple fried rice was just aight. ive had better. My faaavorite thing was their charbroiled beeef. It was cooked medium rare and accompanied by their special house sauce that was bursting with flavor. This dish alone will keep me coming back for more. We also had their jerky which i really liked. Although i felt that the jerky tasted better with the beef sauce as opposed to the sauce it came with. Overall, reasonably priced, large portions..and I'll probably be back the next time im in Vegas and in need of a Thai fix.

Came here after First Friday late at night and even though they were closing, they were gracious enough to let us order. Yes, we were "those people." Ocha has been in Vegas for decades and is my family's choice for Thai. My Thai friend whom I was with also frequents this place with her family, so I know it's legit. We ordered about 6 dishes, and for the price it was a bargain!

The service was prompt, and they do a good job of accurately spicing the dishes based on what you tell them. Most Thai restaurants always over do it in my opinion, even after you tell them you're a weenie when it comes to heat. Pad see ew is my staple dish, and it never disappoints. Strongly suggest coming here if you're in the mood!

Don't let the area fool you. It is in a seedy part of town but it is well worth it. This place has been here forever and it went down hill for a while. However it is under new management and they have cleaned it up and made vast improvements. The food is so delicious and the new Manager's name is Note. He will take very good care of you. If you like it spicy, this is the place. If you like less spice, just ask. Portions are big and great for sharing. Take out is also available.This is the best Thai food in the area. By far.

The only authentic thai restaurant on the strip. They can even cook food not on the menu. Beef Jerky, Padthai noodles, Crispy Pork with Broccoli and Papaya Salad were all good. Other than the food, you have excellent customer service by everyone from the server to the owner. I actually cant remember a friendlier place to eat than this! Food was served really fast too. Highly recommended!
Great food but parking lot a bit scary cause of all the loitering their. I say great tip is park as fast as you can and run in. The food is really good. Mongolian beef is yummy

Ocha is your typical quality Thai food.  There's many in the area and Ocha matches them all.  Fair prices, on the higher end of spicy, and easy access.  Ocha goes above others in that their customer service is top of the line.  Free WiFi, specializing in delivery and takeout, and plenty of seating if you decide to dine in.  Parking is available out back as well in a private lot.  A little sketchy area of old Vegas but come down, especially for a cheap lunch meal.  I had only the papaya salad and pad thai so I can't attest to the rest of the menu, but my food was tasty and I would order again.

So glad to find a place with warm cooked meal passed 9pm. Customer service and service is very very friendly and welcoming. Food absolutely delicious, drunken noodles beef and #19 (something hog)! 
I don't come to Vegas often (1-2x a year) but when I do I will be coming back here!

I had a Postmates order of Ocha delivered to me. I was really excited because I have been craving Thai all week.

The food I ordered was a very large portion for $8.95. It was okay but not what I wanted out of Pad Thai. I think I was craving Archie's or Pin Kaow and this wasn't it. It was more of a bland savory flavor than a sweet savory flavor of that makes sense. I didn't really enjoy it.

This was by far the BEST THAI food I have had in a very long time! As a bonus it was off the strip and very affordable and authentic! The service was great and they were very attentive! Next time I come to Las Vegas I will definitely return!!!
I have been a fan of Ocha for many years.  It's my go-to spot for Thai food. Food is fast and fresh the service is friendly.

This was a nice change in scenery from the flashy strip, but not nearly as cheap as it looks from the outside.  A weekend lunch here still ran 2 of us ~$30.  It's also required quite a walk down from the Sahara, maybe 6-7 minutes?

My boyfriend had the Tom Yum soup and I had the Pad Thai.  He would recommended the soup (they can vary the spice level of it), and I felt the Pad Thai (which was not spicy at all) was okay - right flavors but could use a little umph in it.  

We also tried the Thai Iced Tea that everyone had been raving about - it was very good and pretty burnt orange color, but VERY sweet.  Definitely some sweetened condensed milk in there.  I'd almost say it would have been better as a dessert drink than as a beverage with your meal.

My buddy's wife is from Thailand and she cooks Thai for special occasions so I know what REAL Thai taste like. This place is the REAL DEAL . I was blown away by the mint chicken (my fav with white rice) and the Thai style Mongolian beef was outstanding. So far I've only tried one soup  the Tom young shrimp soup and it's amazing. I'm Puerto Rican and Mexican and the soup reminds me of 7 mares (7 seas soup) which I love . It's hard to find good spots on Las Vegas Blvd but this definitely hits the spot when you just want to chill with some friends and have amazing food and some beer. Couldn't ask for more . Check it out you'll see !

We were so impressed with the food when we visited the restaurant that we hired them to cater a big party we had last week. Everyone raved about the food. From the egg rolls to the spicy mint chicken to the pad Thai, the only disappointment we had was that we only had leftovers for one day! You can go wrong here with dine in, carry out, or catering! Highly recommended and have and will continue to return!
Great food , friendly and accommodating  service and a really comfortable atmosphere . We will definitely be making a return visit .

Don't let the neighborhood scare you. This is a classic Thai restaurant in established neighborhood of Las Vegas.  Serving great authentic Thai food for over 20 years. The old downtown is going through redevelopment and this place has the feel of the Old Vegas.  Old classic charm with good food.

We are the only group in the house. We waited 45 minhtes and my friend's noodle soup is still not come out! Very alow service. We ended up cancel that dish! 

My pad see ew is very salty!

This place was really very good.  It wasn't the best Thai I've ever had, but it was great - and a nice break from "Vegas-y" restaurants in Vegas.

It's across the street from the Stratosphere - and kind of a hole-in-the-wall spot.  It gets pretty busy, but I'm not sure if its locals or the folks staying in the motel that shares.  The only odd thing is the windows overlook the pool for some shady motel.... so imagine a pool of fat hairy guys in speedos with LARGE gold chains.  Gross.

The Mongolian beef was gross.  Skip that - but everything else (pad thai, tom yum soup, bamboo shoots and green onions) were very good.
Eh. Food is good... Pricey though. Waiter could be more engaging and making sure we're okay. Don't get a whole lot of food for the price you pay. Just been to better places is what I'm saying.
Came to Las Vegas under the weather and this place made it all better. The soup is amazing.
Service was good and friendly. They give a warning that food takes a while and it does take quite a while. Food is subpar. Overall decent, nothing really stands out.

After a very long day, I came here feeling tired and starving. I was welcomed by the staff and they were so nice to me while also making sure I was properly fed. For the short time I was there, I felt like I welcome into someone's home and they were just so sweet. I got the drunken noodles at level 7 spice and it was so painfully good. After enjoying the noodles, I couldn't stop so I also ordered green curry to go. I can't wait to come here and bring some company next time. Thank you for your warm hospitality and food!

I wasn't too impressed, unfortunately. I ordered the house fried rice and it was basically rice with onions, hardly any beef, chicken, or shrimp. The curry was good, other than that nothing to brag about.

I've ordered delivery from Ocha for the last 2 years. I've never actually been inside the place. But everything that has been deliverd to me over the years has always been above any other downtown delivery joint. There was ONE time they messed up pretty bad.. But recovered from it. They knew we order from them A LOT.
They value their customers especially regulars!

Favorites:
Thai Beef Jerky (salsa is so good ask for 1 more!)
Cornish Hen ( so so good)

Absolutely one of the best Thai meals I have ever had.  The menu was excellent, however, we met the owner of the restaurant when we walked in, had great conversation with him, and we ended up asking him to order for us.  He is the expert, after all.  
The food was outstanding and the service impeccable!  Wish I were in town more often to visit this establishment.  With over 300 Thai restaurants in Vegas, this one is a must to visit!

Great Food for reasonable prices. Friendly staff.place looks nice. Could use some more high chairs because when I ate there with my 1 year old they were all out and my son had to sit on my lap the entire meal.

Ocha was very good. I went for lunch.  The place was very clean and not very busy around 1:15pm.  I ordered the Drunken Noodle(Pad Ka Mao), but it wasn't on the menu.  My friend ordered a coconut curry dish.  They were both good.  I ordered a 7 on the spicy scale and I would say it was closer to a 9, but very good.  At the recommendation of the server, we ordered the beef jerky as the appetizer.  It was AWESOME!  I would go back just for that alone.  They have a small stage in the dining room, so I wonder if they have bands or Karaoke or what. The service was quick and efficient.  Good place for a quick lunch.
Food was amazing! Karaoke bar was a plus. We had a huge group and came in late around 10pm and they still accommodated us.

Decided to try Ocha for Sunday dinner based on the recommendation of a Thai friend. It's located on Las Vegas Blvd in a seedy part of town. It was easy to find and had ample parking. We walked in to a spotless restaurant with shiny clean floors. We were greeted immediately and seated in a comfortable booth. The server came over to take our drink order and answer any questions we had. She returned a few minutes later with the drinks and took our food orders. 

The food started coming out a short time later. Presentation was on point, temperature was perfect and everything smelled delicious. A runner came by to inform us there was no yellow curry, which was disappointing. He recommended the green which was a wonderful substitute. I had also wanted Tom Yum Goong, but they only make it with chicken broth, which I cannot eat. 

The food was very good and the server checked on us at regular intervals. The only negative was the spice level scale. It is based on 1 to 10, 10 being hottest. My husband ordered 10 for himself and I ordered 4 for the dishes shared with the kids. I was caught off guard when I took a big bite of shrimp salad and my tongue was on fire. Same with the green shrimp curry. The flavors were amazing and the spice wasn't a big deal, but I'll remember to order  3 or below for the kids next time. 

Overall, we enjoyed our meal and will come back again. A family of 4 with 5 dishes( plenty to take home for lunch tomorrow), 3 Thai iced teas and 1 beer--with 18% tip around $80. Perfect!!

Family owned and authentic. No stereotypical cheesy Hollywood thai decor here, roomy and good for big groups. Off the strip but worth the trip. It's in a somewhat sketch looking area but the warm service staff makes up for it. Thai beef jerky, crying tiger, and raw shrimp is on point. If you want good food without the pretentious air of Las Vegas come here.

Great recipes and prices. I usually grab takeaway and they do a good job. Some places will put hot food directly into styrofoam, which melts thru. They line their containers with foil. Big portions too.

Family Friendly!!! We come here every Friday with our two children 1 and 3 y.o. They are very friendly and the food is best. We always order the beef jerky and there yellow curry. If you are down town and looking for a family friendly environment this Thai restaurant is the best.

It often seems to me that there are more Thai restaurants in Vegas than there are roulette wheels!  I've done much of the research already.... so save yourself the time, the money, and the energy (which I have already invested!). With that said, I feel I can confidently make this statement:  Ocha Thai Cuisine is the BEST THAI IN VEGAS!
Each dish is just the best in class from the appearance to the taste!  Therefore, I encourage you to end your "seemingly endless" search for great Thai food in the Vegas Valley and heed my advice and recommendation for a taste sensation - Eat at Ocha Thai Cuisine.  You'll be so glad that you did!

I was looking for another Thai place but it was closed.  I found this gem just by searching on yelp.  The service was fast and friendly.  I had the pad thai.  It was both fresh and delicious.  The price was very affordable.  I will come back here next time I come to Vegas!

This family owned restaurant has been around for many years! Upon returning recently, we've come to understand that the original owners have passed the business to a younger generation of their family. Whom is a bright young and eager businessman/ entrepreneur. With that being said he is trying to bring all the potential out of the restaurant (in which I applaud) we need more of this in Vegas. He has live entertainment every night, a new variety of cocktails, and alcoholic beverages. (I'm a bartender so this is a stamp of approval in my book!) he's also expanded the restaurant to accommodate more patrons.
 So why did I give it 3 Stars???
 I get it!! it's gonna take some time, and I will be returning with an update of my review accordingly. I love his vision! Howeverrrrr the entertainment on Monday (with all do respect!,,"Shade No Shade") was awful, the service was not up to par, they weren't knowledgeable of the menu or beverages, and the lack of attentiveness was unpleasant. "Kicker"...we ordered a bottle of wine and it came to the table straight out of the display (WARM). 
With that being said, the food still is "amazing" so please don't hesitate to give this place a try. We all have to start from somewhere and learn, that's why I am posting this review. So hopefully this helps this business, and encourages you to go and support a new innovative businessman on his journey to bring some culture to Las Vegas, along with delicious food for the soul.

I love the papaya salad here, i order it spicy and they really do make it spicy. =) their array of thai food is mouth watering.  Food is great although you might not notice it the first time around the block, it can be tricky to spot out Ocha, tucked into the line of motels.  Its absolutely the best Thai food ever!

Definitely our must go to spot in the LVC for Thai food.  A bit off from the main strip (closer to the Stratosphere) but well worth the trip.  Beef Kra Paow, shrimp fried rice and the Thai beef jerky are excellent!  Cool that spiciness and perfect saltiness with a refreshing Thai ice tea.  Highly recommend!

Ocha is the most amazing Thai food in the Las Vegas Valley! The location is ideal, and parking is always a breeze. Service is QUICK! Food is delicious! Thai Tea is to died for!! I love the music and live singers! The owners are very caring, and you can tell passionate about their restaurant. We love coming here to relax, meet with friends and have a great time with amazing food.
My favorite place for Thai beef jerky, great service and fast as always.

Best Thai food in Las Vegas! I moved from the Bay Area and I have been here for just over 2 years. I have been looking for the best Thai food in Vegas... I am happy that I found Ocha Thai to cater a big party I had recently! The food was the great. The chef is a real Thai chef. Everyone there is Thai. All the food taste just like real Thai food from my home town! I also discovered that the chef and the family that owns Ocha Thai from North Eastern Thailand (where I am from). That means they make very good Larb /Yum(meat salad), Papaya salad and Thai noodle soup ! and healthy Thai country food.
The price is reasonable and the restaurant is clean and the staff is really helpful! I highly recommend Osha Thai to everyone!!!
Love this place...   Brings back memories when I went there with someone important...
My usual lunch spot. Great portions for the price. Make sure to try the thai tea! It's outstanding!

First off we went there the two times and we ordered papaya salad fried beef jerky and Tom yum soup , everything was good and delicious so on our last day before we left Vegas we went there again and ordered fish, beef larb, papaya salad and beef jerky . After we have left Vegas we didn't start getting sick  until we almost got to Long Beach and we threw up and had diarrhea all day and night long. I believe we got food poisoning. I've never been food poisoning before in my life and this was the first time it happened to all of us. Me my hubby and 2 kids all had food poisoning after our lunch there.

Stopped in for a quick curry. I've never been here before, but the food and service were great. The curry isn't quite as sweet as I'm used to, but it's a large portion and very flavorful. Give them a try!

Pretty much my favorite Thai food in Vegas. Everything is inexpensive. Portions are huge. I got the stink eye from the waitress a couple times but this didn't negate the grub. 

THE only BAD thing that happened when I was here was a few hours later my entire body broke out in red splotches. Didn't switch up what I ordered, so I figure something must have been added that I was allergic too. It has NOT deterred me from going there time and time again.

Best Thai food in Vegas  
Not only is the food the best thing here but the service is always great, every time I go the servers go above and beyond. The servers are very attentive and kid friendly . The restaurant is very spacious inside and they have live music going on, which is nice! Definitely recommend this place!

Everything was delicious. we ordered drunken noodles & they were sooo spicy so if you don't like spicy food like me just be a littttle careful on the number lol. We also order Tum yum soup it was amazing!
Service was great, but the food left a lot to be desired.

Ah Yelp photos let me down. I've been searching for more of a Thai style Tom Kha Gai and I literally searched through all Yelps of the Thai places in Vegas to find one similar to Lao Thai Kitchen which changed owners.

I finally decided to try Ocha's version for lunch with some friends based on the photos I saw.

First of all the restaurant is huge. It was actually pretty busy on a Saturday afternoon. We were seated promptly and there was one server. 

The price points are average for Thai food in Vegas. The dishes were on average $11-$12 which is okay. There's some cheaper places and some more expensive.

The place wasn't so nice inside as the table was all beat up with some sharp areas you'll have to be careful of.

We got pad thai which was good but nothing special. Not the best but most the worst. On the plus side it did stay nice and moist. 

We got Thai beef salad which was okay. It really just tasted like it was dressed with lime juice. It was really one note. There was pretty much just lettuce and some beef slices. 

Last we got the Tom Kha Gai. It was not good. I know that Laos and Thai people all make it different and I've had this soup many times. I've heard of the sour flavor from the soup coming from lime or tamarind. This place definitely used tamarind and it was super sour and super salty. You couldn't taste any spice just salt and sour. The portions of chicken and mushroom in here were generous though. I can't say that about the pad Thai or beef salad though.

My two positives were that they gave us a generous serving of white rice & I believe the sticky rice was on the house. That reminds me their rice was not good. Sometimes you just want plain old white rice and they definitely didn't use jasmine rice. Otherwise it was not cooked well because it was dry.

Overall our lunch kind of was lame. Service was slow as our server was pretty slammed so we were barely checked on. We also got our check super late BUT they were able to split it three ways and there wasn't a card minimum which is nice. I wouldn't recommend this place
Absolutely love this place! The food is always amazing every time I'm here. The service is great! So friendly and helpful! The garlic prawns are one of my fav. Must try!
I ordered delivery at 8:39pm today. It didn't arrive until 10PM sharp!?

a must if you're in Vegas! i'm so picky when it comes to thai/laos because i'm always trying to find entrees close to my home (Cambodia). the food is delicious! ordered - pad see ew, pad thai, papaya salad (laos style), chicken larb, thai beef jerky, & fried pork with Chinese broccoli & i highly recommend all of them  the owner was very involved which i think is so important in the restaurant & customer service business. we came on my birthday & after the owner was conversating with us, they dimmed the lights & brought ice cream with a candle on top and sang happy birthday  definitely a happy customer!! & a bonus free thai tea when you check in!

Walking past it, you would think this was a divey place with terrible food.  My friends brought me here and the soup was awesome.  I forget the name of it, I think it was Tom Kar Gai.  Mmmm, I could go for some right now.

Don't let the neighborhood preclude  you!  

Food is good, waiter has a Great sense humor. 

Very clean.

Great service from the new owner and staff. He was very attentive and helpful with us. 

Food was delicious. Owner suggested shrimp  pad Thai. It was amazing. We also had seafood soup with steam rice. 

The place was clean and prices are also great. The portions of each dish are enough for 2 people.

Good quality thai food. not the best area, but the service is the best!
We have a little toddler that was thirsty and Naree offered some lemonade for free.
The chicken took a little long and Do the waiter was honest enough to tell us that there was some miscommunication in the kitchen. Other waiters will simply just say that it is still being prepared.
We cancelled the chicken later on, and Do just gave it to us for free since it was prepared already and he will have to pay for it from his pocket.
Very high quality service! I highly recommend them! Not to mention we got some free thai tea also from a Yelp check-in.
But this review is completely unbiased, I gave them a $10 tip for being so nice.

I recently went back for another visit to Ocha, and the prices totally went up. I don't think there was anything cheaper than like $9, which at a Thai Restaurant is sacrilege. When you visit an authentic Thai Restaurant, you're expecting good food at decent prices, I understand the economy is bad, but it doesn't give them the right to rape us! Now on to the food, it was OK... Don't order the boat noodle because it's not what you're thinking. The broth is clear, they added small intestine... I don't know what's going on there, but it clearly was not the boat noodle that I am accustom to. The beef jerky however was delicious, the sauce tasted like salsa you can pick up at Baja Fresh, but the meat was very good. Beef panang was alright, nothing spectacular, just beef curry, we asked for spicy and it came out mild, go figure. Next time I'm in town, I don't know if I will re-visit Ocha, I think it's time to find another Thai restaurant in Vegas.

Came here for the first time tonight for 2 reasons. #1. I LOVE Thai Food #2. They had a viewing for UFC 208 here. The food is amazing, the prices are reasonable and the service is amazing. The owner, Note, introduced himself to me and my husband. Really nice guy! I highly recommend this place! Great family atmosphere and cool place to have dinner and watch fights!

Let me start by saying that I love Thai food, I have tried many Thai places (California as well as Arizona). Ocha Cuisine was one of the top Thai places I have visited. My husband and I spent a few days in Las Vegas this weekend and this was our first stop as soon as we got to Vegas. One of our friends told us about this place, he actually gave us a list of appetizers/main courses that we should try. We decided to try the Chicken Pad Thai as well as the Yum Nur Nam Tok (beef). I have eaten a lot of beef salad in Thai restaurant, but let me tell you something, this one was by far the best salad that I have ever eaten! The beef was excellent, same thing goes for the seasoning. If you do not like spicy, this is not a salad for you!
We will definitively be back when we are in Vegas!!

1.5 stars. Don't get  the sun beef unless you like hard, dry, tough, stringy meat. Don't get the sticky rice unless you like to choke on dry sticky tasteless rice that comes in a sandwich bag. Don't get the green papaya salad- its not fresh, its over sauced. The service is horribly slow and the price is high. I was hugely disappointed considering the reviews.

Decent Thai food! Tried the seafood tom Kha got pot...papaya salad crab...eggrolls...Beef larb and sticky rice. Ordered 3 thai teas and one pink lemonade equates to roughly $53. Service was good. Quality of food was good. There's a big sign signaling it's location, but after the turn,  you might lose sight of where the entrance actually is! It's right there at the corner although the parking is kinda funky...

I am writing this review since I've been coming to Ocha for years. They serve solid, reasonably affordable Thai food. I've tried all of their curries, they are all really good. Their pad thai and lunch specials are good too. The service, however, is not their strong point. We used to knowone o fthe guys that worked here and he would get us a table and take our orders real fast. I haven't seen him in over a year though.

They recently moved to a new location, they are no longer in the crappy hotel. They are now located a couple block north, still on Las Vegas Blvd. It's in front of the Econolodge. The sign is really, really small, and from the outside it looks like the place has been abandoned. They need to spruce it up a bit. The building looks to me like it was a tropical-themed nightclub. The  space is huge, nice and airy. There is dance floor, which confirms my dance club theory, and it looks like in the evening they have karaoke. 

This is a good option if you are in the downtown area lookin for Thai food, but are not willing to go down to E. Freemont.

This is a hole-in-the-wall Thai restaurant- not much ambiance (sometimes that doesn't matter as long as the food is good). I've been going to this restaurant for a long time- this is the 3rd location since I've lived here (the first location was where the Stratosphere parking lot is, along Main Street, the second location was on Las Vegas Blvd., near Charleston, in a Thai plaza- now closed entirely- had music and a state-of-the-art karaoke system). 

I would usually get the Pad Thai & Thai Beef Salad (really good here). I also tried the stuffed chicken wings and Thai style rice (also very good) a while back. I went here with my husband a few times and one of my good friends (she's been back a few times after that with her husband BTW), but haven't been back in a while. Looks like a return visit is in order, and a review update.

Still Consistently Delicious and Fresh after many years of ordering from here! Just what the doctor ordered! Plus they are soooo friendly! They are family owned and they treat you like family! 

Having been raised in the restaurant business, I'm a harsh harsh critic, so if I say it's good food, it's good food.  

Pad Thai, Panang, Mint Chili Chicken... What am I saying!?! It's ALL good! You cannot go wrong here!

This restaurant was truly a gem. The waiter (also the OWNER!) and the staff was extremely pleasant and made us feel like home. Food was beyond yummers! We decided to go back the second night for round 2! Highly recommend if you are near Las Vegas. Did I mention they had karaoke?!
Excellent customer service, beautiful atmosphere, small stage with a live band. Perfect place for large groups.

Very authentic thai food! I had the beef jerky, pad thai, papaya salad and sticky rice ! All were delicious. They offer a huge thai tea ! I took off one star for the location. But I will definitely come back for the service and food.

Were visiting from California for a festival when I wanted some food that reminded me of home.  Where I live Thai/Cambodian/Lao/Japanese.... You get it I eat a lot of Asian food.  I eat papaya salad quite often even though the bf doesn't like it. 
     We ordered angel wings, on the menu they are called stuffed chicken wings.  They are deep fried and delicious. But I came here in hopes to eat some yummy, spicy, fresh papaya salad.  I saw that there were two different kinds, those of which I eat, yet I wanted to see how their flavor tasted.  I ordered sticky rice along with it.  The bf ordered the chicken pad Thai lunch, which in turn was filling.  
     The salad was the way I normally have it, spicy but not too spicy.  The papaya was fresh along with the tomatoes and the peanuts are ALWAYS my favorite to munch on.  Over all, it scored high in my book. Whenever I come back, this will be my pit stop for food!

I grew up with Ocha being in my backyard. I used to live in the apartments behind the Stratosphere and Ocha was the go to spot when my mom was too tired to cook. This place taste like home to me and after so many years I still look forward to late nights here.
This has been our favorite local joint to visit when in Vegas.  The food is great and it has not failed me yet.  Its cheap food and authentic.

Their food was yummy! I was craving Thai food late at night and thankfully this place is open until 12am (Saturday). 

We did a pick up order and brought it home. After the commute home it was still very tasty! 

Brasil Beef (ground beef, spicy level 3 of 10) 4/5 stars 
This dish had a lot of juice in it which is not normally how I have the dish at other Thai places. I ordered a spicy level 3 but it tasted more like a 5. I didn't mind it because I love spicy food but my boyfriend doesn't like super spicy but he still enjoyed it and ate it...lol I think it was spicier because of all the juice in the dish and the chili peppers soaked in it! 

Chicken Pad See Ew (spicy level 3 of 10) 4/5 stars. 
This was a great dish! The noodles were tender but not over cooked. There was a good amount of chicken in the dish. The only negative comment was that the Chinese broccoli in the dish, there were a lot of steams and very few 'tops' of the broccoli to really enjoy it. This dish however was more correct on the spice level of a 3.

This place use to be amazing. I come very often. The service is always great the lady's are sweet but recently it's been hit or miss w their curry. I always get the curry but yesterday's was so runny and awful. Please make it better.

Sehr freundliche Bedienung und leckere Gerichte. Wir waren am späten Nachmittag dort und es war komplett leer. Dadurch konnte man gemütlich und in Ruhe essen. Die Portionen fielen für amerikanische Verhältnisse zwar nicht so riesig aus, aber man wurde satt. Gerne wieder.
Very welcoming, great service, took care of out last minute family outing. Twelves of us total and they where able to make sure everyone had what they needed at all times, thank you Ochas'!
Meal was delicious,my first Thai experience. Definitely will be coming back. Definitely recommend this place if you are in Las Vegas.

Went there with my wife & 3 year old son. We tried rice noodles for the first time and really liked it, and the chicken skewers were nice too. I got one thai ice tea for free just for checking in on Yelp. Loved the tea!
This is one of the best restaurant in Las Vegas by far. The owner of the restaurant is absolutely delightful. Everything on the menu is so delicious.

Great food & great prices. We love the pad thai noodles & Chinese broccoli with crispy pork. We've been here multiple times but this particular time the service was lacking a little bit. Food took longer than usual, we had to ask for water, & when we were ready to pay, we had to approach the counter after waiting too long for the check. Perhaps we just stopped in on a bad night? Despite the not so good service this time around, we'll probably still keep going back because the food really is that good.
Food is delicious and the customer service is great. Eating here again for sure. Also convienient location for any one downtown
Free Thai tea with check in! I always forget the name of this soup, but it's soooooo good! Delicious coconut taste!

What a great experience in the midst of the downtown hustle! Who knew one can find authentic and delicious Thai food next to multiple wedding chapels, souvenir stores and pawn shops? Drive slow on Las Vegas boulevard to find Ocha because it is quite inconspicuous on the avenue. 

What this restaurant lacks in decor and ambiance, it makes up for its homestyle flavor. My party consisted of carnivores and I being the only vegetarian was disappointed by the menu at first glance. I explained to the waiter my dietary 'issues' and asked if I could substitute tofu for any of the dishes that called for chicken, fish, pork or beef. BTW I am always leery of restaurants willing to do this, they usually are short on flavor or mix 'meat or fish' flavors in the dish. Well.....my dish rocked! 

Another plus is that the waiter seemed to be working solo but was super attentive and kind. Service was excellent. Table was cleaned and drinks were refilled consistently and not in an annoying way. Our waiter was like a ninja superstar! 

I am very impressed with Ocha and definitely recommend this establishment.

This place is a stones throw away from the Stratosphere and shares the Holiday House Motel 's parking lot . My husband and I ended up here through one of our many compromises. I wanted Chinese food and he said he would be fine just as long as they serve Thai Beef Salad. I thought "Great ....I don't know of any Chinese place that makes Thai Beef Salad!" Luckily we came to Ocha because this is a Thai place that serves Chinese food too! We both win! Yay! 

He had the salad of course which was just as tasty as the other Thai places we frequent. I was craving Chow mien so I ordered the lunch special that came with white rice and an egg roll. The Chow Mien was okay the noodles were a little thicker then I prefer but it still tastes great with a little Siracha. I enjoyed the egg roll because they put see through rice noodles in there. I don't see that a lot. The star of the meal was the Beef Jerky! I was hoping it wouldn't be like 7-11 beef jerky ...that would be pretty hard to eat with rice. What came out were these tasty pieces of beef . They are a little tough on the outside but not as hard as your local 7 -11 's jerky. The inside of the jerky was nice and chewy. I would come back just for this dish alone . I don't see many Thai places offering Beef Jerky unless I overlooked it. This is one of my new favorite Thai dishes that I would like to try if offered at other restaurants.
Great place to find inexpensive delicious food in Vegas.  Plus they are open till at least 3 am.

Just had a 50 person dinner here and it was far beyond our expectations. Every detail was taken care of by their staff and my customers had a blast.  We had such a wonderful time that everyone sang karaoke on their professional system. Don't let the location or the outside fool you this is a one of kind place with the staff and food to make your evening special. We will definitely be back with even more people.

As good as it gets that's right! This place has the best authentic thai food in town! I say authentic because the dishes are on point for flavor. My favorite is their naked shrimp and pad see ew! My all time must go every time I visit Vegas meal.
The food took forever to arrive and when it did I was grossed out.  The pad thai was more like greasy chow mein.
Service suck!!  I see they gave better service to everyone else except us.  Everyone that came after us got their food.  One star is way too much.  We waited an hour n still didn't get our food.

Dont let the dated interior scare you away bec this place serve good Thai quality food. We ordered the large seafood tom yum soup extra spicy. The soup was huge with clear soup and taste was good. We got Free Thai ice tea for checking in on Yelp. The servers were very attentive and tool care of group. We will definitely come back for more.

Packs a surprising spicy punch for Thai food in Las Vegas. Not the highest quality meat, but sauces were delicious, and servers were super nice. Beef salad, papaya salad, and especially red curry tofu were quite nice. Rice was slightly overcooked, wish the meet and papaya were of higher-quality, but a very solid choice for the area.

Hunan nallri are the best servers so nice. Every time I come here I leave very happy and full. The best Thai restaurant in Vegas! I have been coming here since I was 8 years old and nothing has ever changed. 5 stars thanks again Hunan nallri!

Tom Kha Gai!

I love saying that in my best Bruce Lee accent (and in the most obnoxious,"I'm gonna kick your booty Muay Thai style  if I don't get it",  way).

It's also my favorite thing to order at any given Thai restaurant. I don't eat pork or beef (as most of you already know), so of course  we ordered this one with all the seafood trimmings. I really enjoyed the delicious broth that came with this soup. The squid was rubbery and overcooked, though. Freshness in seafood are a must! Again, the broth was to die for: just the right about of savory and tangy and spicy.

Ok, so how about the the other fare?

The giant prawns were spectacular! So succulent and perfectly cooked. The Hawaiian rice was the most disappointing addition to our dinner table: greasy and underseasoned.  I took it home and "doctored it up" with some scallions, peas and carrots, cilantro and soy, and it became much more comestible. But why should I have to use my culinary degree for such activities when THEY cooked it?! 

The service was prompt and friendly. It's definitely not an ambiance for romance, and I highly recommend you either: A) BYOB or B)Come in already liquored up. 
Oh well, the highlight of the evening was the fabulous wine selection they had at their beer and wine only "bar" (Insert sarcasm here:___________).
The lady had the nerve to bring me White Zinfandale  when I asked for a "nice glass of red wine". OMG! My inner sommelier wanted to SCREAM as I eyed this Sutter Home disaster in a glass. Egad!


Honestly, they actually had Bartles & James featured as their "Wine Cooler of the day". I know how much we all crave a great fuzzy navel cheerleader beer with our spicy Thai food, right?


Enough of that...

Good points: Hooray for being open 24 hours! After a wicked session of Muay Thai boxing it was nice to get some "late night" Thai eats. This place definitely scores bonus points as the "only viable Thai option available after a certain hour."  We all know that Thai places are notorious for closing wicked early (why!?!?), so that was cool.


Ok, I'm going to stop being a food snob now. If you want some decent eats at a fair price with a "no frills" attitude, then here ya go! 


Go get 'em, tiger!



Footnote: My BFF/dining partner reminded me of this other traumatic beverage incident : After I sent back the lovely white zin, the server brought out another glass of wine for me. When I inquired as to what type of wine it was she replied, "Red." 

Argggghhhhh!!!!

My favorite place to come enjoy Thai foods. My favorite dish alway will be Rad Nha pork. I never been disappointed. Great service, all the server very nice and took care of me and my friends. I would recommended to other if you are in town and stay on the strip just stop by.

I've been here three times in the past month for takeout and all three experiences were good. I've had the panang curry, the red curry and the pad thai. All three were well spiced and flavorful and the food quality was good. The prices are reasonable and the staff is friendly. 

Update 4/10: Recent cons I've experienced here are the chef, on more than one occasion, spiced the food well beyond what I asked for and sometimes it takes multiple calls to get someone to answer the phone to take my order. Still my go to downtown but downgraded one star.
Great place to eat , always a must to stop by for dinner or lunch. Service is the best in town, our server Gammie was AWESOME, great customer service.

I read the reviews, and thought I would give the place a try, having eaten off of many Chinese lunch menus back in IL. Based off of the ten or so very similar menus I have dined off of, I would rank this as last, or second to last. 
We both ordered the Kung Pao extra spicy lunch special and the chicken and veggies were haphazardly splashed on the plate, and there were about 10 percent protein on my dish, and even less on my husbands, unfortunately for my husband, but lucky for me, he doesn't eat the veggies, so I wasn't that hungry when I left. Oh, and he had veggies mixed with his chicken that I didn't get with mine, a I mostly got celery. In the photo, my meal was depicted, and although it shows a lot of chicken, that's pretty much all the chicken that I was provided. 
All in all, I was very dissatisfied as the dish was bland, and we left hungry.

I was in the neighborhood and decided to try Ocha based on the yelp reviews. This is one of the rare times that yelp has led me astray. 

I arrive to a near empty restaurant, which is usually a bad sign, but since the sign outside implied that Ocha was newly opened, I took a seat anyway. The two dining areas could have held probably 200 patrons, and there were only 4 of us customers at 7pm on a Wednesday. We customers were actually outnumbered by the front room staff not to mention the kitchen employees. 

Anyway, the food. Based on the waiter's recommendation, I ordered a mongolian beef dinner special which was an entree with a soup and eggroll. 

Well, not only was the food not very good, there wasn't enough of it! If I weren't taught by my mom not to "waste" food, I probably wouldn't have eaten much of the Mongolian beef which tasted "funny" in addition to being too spicy and salty. I did end up eating everything but got hungry again less than 3 hrs later. 

Also, I should note that the majority of the menu (and the entire dinner special section) consist of Chinese dishes, not Thai. This is weird because the owners and employees of the establishment are clearly Thai (I've heard enough of the language to be able to recognize it). 

Perhaps their Thai food is better than what I had. But I won't be going back to find out.

My wife and I tried Ocha Thai for the first time recently.  The restaurant is located in a less than desirable, read seedy, section of the the LV Blvd, but there is a private parking lot available so we were not concerned. We were greeted shortly after entering and directed to a booth.  Although billed as Thai, there are numerous Malaysian and Chinese menu items.   My wife ordered drunken noodles combination which was loaded with meat and seafood, but rather light on the noodles.  I chose Ba dook pad ped - deep fried catfish in chili sauce with red bell pepper and basil.  Mine was good, but the catfish were not quite as crispy as I have experienced in the past. Overall we were happy with our dining experience and would not hesitate to dine there again.

Thanks to a good friend/coworker's recommendation, I was able to try out this Thai restaurant downtown. It's a good hole-in- the-wall spot located in an area I probably wouldn't venture to if she hadn't been there so many times. We were greeted by a nice young lady and were seated right away. We sat by the stage area and I thought they had karaoke. One of the workers told me they will have someone sing I've in half an hour. It was around 6:15 p.m. on a Friday night so I'm guessing they have live music weekends? Cool either way. It's a charming stage to add to the vibe. 

I ordered the chicken pad Thai in spicy level number one and my friend ordered the pad se ew in spicy level number three. Food came out fairly quickly and the portions were enough for seconds or even thirds! My friend suggested the fried wontons as well. They were good, but not my type of appetizer. The wontons were folded into a triangle shaped and filled with a dollop of ground pork. It was crispy and came with a side of spicy vinegar like dipping sauce.  If you like crispy and crunchy apps, then you would like the fried wontons.

The chicken pad Thai was very flavorful. It had a slight heat to it and that's when I realized our spice preferences were mixed. My pad Thai was supposed to be a one level and I got spice level 3. My friend's pad se ew was a level 1 instead of a 3. Not a big deal actually because the little extra kick of heat was quite tasty. Although I think my friend was kind of missing some heat, but she said she was fine as it was. The waiter came back to check on us and we informed him of the spice level mix up. He quickly offered to redo the food, but we said it was ok because the food was still delicious. 

All in all, the food was hot and delicious. The prices were affordable and you get a lot of food for it. Service was attentive and it had a no frills kind of atmosphere. Parking is somewhat limited, so it might be tricky finding a spot to park if this place were to get busy. I would come back if I was in the area.
Delicious, the "Crouching Tiger" is absolutely an item you should order. I always get a shrimp Tom Yum. The service and good here is great.

I lived here for more than 20 years. I must have driven past this place more than 100 times not knowing that this place was here. My friend brought me here one day and wow I can't believe how good and spicy the food is. This is my fourth time in less than one month. I love this place it's so freaking  good can't believe it. I order my food spicy a number 10 and it feels like I'm dreaming while I'm eating it's so flavorful. Sam the waiter will take care of you.

3.5 stars for the completely interesting experience. 

We came Saturday night around 9pm, and there was only one big group there celebrating a birthday. There was a DJ lady playing Youtube videos (by request) and occasionally singing. And top it all off with a parquet dance floor with disco ball for the big group's kids to jump around singing and dancing to LMFAO. We noted that it felt like we were at a 1990s prom. Amazing.

The food was fine. The Thai tea is only $2 but was extremely sweet (like 2x a normal Thai tea). The pork pad see ew was decent, but not particularly flavorful or salty and saucy enough. I did really enjoy the Yum Nur Nam Tok though, which is grilled strips of beef, mint leaves, red onion, green onion, ground rice, and spicy sauce. 

This seems to be a late-night place. The restaurant started filling up more around 10pm.

I've been a couple of times here and I think it's a very good choice if you are looking for good quality, good portions and excellent price. The have very accessible specials and most of them are very good in flavor and amount. The place looks brand new, and most of the time its pretty quiet and relaxing environment. There is thou, a waiter that apparently is always mad about something, but not in a bad way, it actually is kinda hilarious. The pad thai chicken is very good, the fried rice is awesome and most of the specials on the menu are good for any appetite. The place is on an area with not as many good options like this around, so i definitely recommend.

This is easily my favorite Thai restaurant I've ever been too and even one of my favorite restaurants all together now. The food is always amazing and the service is always great. The price is fair. What more can you ask for? 

Tom Kha Gai I think it's called. It's a sour spicy seafood soup. It is absolutely amazing.

The Panang Curry is the best curry I've ever had and easily the best Panang. I've ate curry at more places than I can keep track of anymore at both Indian and Thai restaurants. This curry is hands down the best I've had. If you like curry, give it a try.

Worth for you cost, food is tasty and I like spicy as I am from South India and as I asked for extra spicy they really cooked chicken fried rice and Penang curry as I was expecting to eat. Definitely good place for Togo style, restaurant ambiance is not good. Very near to stratosphere hotel and casino.

Whenever I go to Vegas... This place is as must for me!! I love their beef jerky and sticky rice!!!! So the 5 stars is only for that. If I start reviewing the other entrees.... Stars will be less :( Anywhos the beef jerky is the bomb!!! If you'r e hungry find another place... But for late late night snack and something light...order their jerky and their humongous to-go cup thai ice tea ;)

I've been going to this spot for over 10 years and I've got only 5 words to say:   "ONE SUN BEEF" and "STICKY RICE"!  

Seriously, this place has got some of the best thai food in town.  It may not be in the nicest area (across the street from the Stratosphere) or be the nicest looking (you can say cheap decor, I say AUTHENTIC) or even have the coldest AC (cause its hot up in that piece) but you really feel like your in Thailand eating there (just sweatin and eating, lol)  

The Service....hahaha, where do I start.... well they have the great humor and are really blunt with people (maybe thats why I think the are humorous)  

BEST THAI FOOD IN VEGAS!

I ate here for the first time the other day.  I had egg foo young which was made differently than I have ever experienced and it was delicious. The menu offers Thai and Chinese food to give plenty to choose from  The service was perfect.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for great Chinese or Thai food

I'll admit, I haven't tried any other Thai restaurant in Vegas, just yet.  The BF loves this place because they serve this beef jerky appetizer that is a bit unique and tastes pretty good.

Ocha Restaurant is located right next to a motel, between a couple of chapels...not too far from the Stratosphere.  You can hop on over to Luv-It Custard after wards!

I was there the other day and made it in time for their lunch specials.  Not wanting to fill up too much since it was a late lunch, I went for the standard pad thai chicken lunch special.  For $5.95, it came with rice and an egg roll.  The pad thai was standard and it decent lunch overall.  The real winner was the Thai iced tea ($2.00).  I used to make it all the time for my old job and they make it pretty good over here.  Yum yum!

Overall, a 3.5 star rating.  It's a no frills kind of place.  No particular ambiance or anything, you're really here for the food.

Lunch specials: $5.95 Mondays through Fridays, excluding holidays. 11:00 am to 3:30 pm
Dinner specials: $7.95 Mondays through Fridays, excluding holidays. 6:00 pm to 10:00 pm

Update! 04.18.08 - Grabbed a quick dinner and had the rice noodles with gravy.  I had it with vegetables instead of meat and they really loaded up on the veggies. (It looked more like a vegetable dish than a noodle dish!)  So, they are definitely not skimpy there!  The BF had his favorite, the Thai Beef Jerky (Nice tender beef brisket in thai spice sun-dried then deep fried.) $7.95.  I've never had it anywhere else and it's pretty tasty, you might want some sticky rice with it!  We also shared a gigantic order of Thai tea.  You have to request this special size since it's not on the menu, but it's a honking cup!

the best thai restaurant! food is divine! hospitality is spectacular! get close to locals in an open yet intimate atmosphere! ask for the pompano and mekhong and engage with the best of tastiness overall. love this place! 6 stars!
Ocha Thai Cuisine is the best Thai Food in Vegas. I've been coming to Ocha for the past five years. If you want great authentic food and friendly service Ocha is it. The owner Bundit is awesome!
This place has really good food. They have the best Thai jerky I've ever had. Too bad they have really bad service or I'd be there more often.

If only I lived in Vegas then this would be my to -go place! Found them through Yelp!  and so glad I gave them a try - it was a fairly empty night when we got there but still nice - it's a big location and they have a stage. We had their jerky as suggested by the awesome server who hooked it up with a nice amount of the dipping sauce (yum!!!) their thai tea was awesome. All items I've tried were great regardless. Will be coming back for this

Decent, large portions, cheap. 

It's no Le Thai of course, but don't be fooled or put off by the fact that the place is half Chinese. Aren't all the places in Vegas fusion anyways? 

Although Chinese/Thai food seems inauthentic in say LA, it's the norm in vegas.  We got the spicy basil chicken, pineapple fried rice and a third dish. Split between 3, it came out to 9.67 with tax and the portions were huge.  

Not a bad option if you want food, and don't need a super hip atmosphere. (the place is sort of chinese restaurant too --- kinda ghetto heh)

After spending time at the casinos, we were looking for some thai takeout to take back to the room for my brother and his gf since they were nice enough to watch our toddler son while we went on a date.  This was the only place still open after 10pm.  I remember eating at one of the older locations many years ago and the food was decent.  The new location is much nicer and larger complete with live music capability and a small dancefloor.  Only one table was seated, which I guess does not say much since it was a Monday night at a non-strip location.  We try our best not to eat at any strip restaurants since the food is generally over-priced and in our experience, horrible.  We like to eat where the locals would eat .  The server was very friendly and welcoming and told us to sit down at a table since the counter was dark.  The menu had a good variety, did not have my favorite pad ki mao, but I was able to order Thai Beef Jerky, Nam Sod Salad, which are my brother's favorite.  I also ordered Pad Thai and Pork Belly with Chinese Broccoli for his gf.  Portions were ok for the price, aside for the chinese broccoli, since it did not come with rice and it's not like the box was even half full.  The Nam Sod had good flavor but I ordered it medium spice and my brother said there was barely any spice.  The pad thai did not have much flavor to it although they did use fresh rice noodles, which is always a plus.  They did not put any condiments in the bag aside from some cheap packets of soy sauce, which is useless to thai people.  For restaurants that serve Isarn style thai food, I expect the spice level to be higher.  I will make a note to order level 10 spicy if we decide to order from them again.  I am glad the server did not handle any of our food since she seated us where we had full view of what was happening behind the bar.  She blew her nose and did not wash or sanitize her hands.  Had she decided to touch our food I would have complained and walked out.  They must have a large crowd later on in the night since they open til 4am on a weekday.  We probably will not dine in.  There are many thai restaurants in the area so we will continue to try more each time we come to Vegas!

Homeless man came in. Bothered the guests and was denied but went up to the counter and asked for food for his family and without batting an eyelash they let him order whatever he wanted free of charge. Heartwarming great service here. Not to mention the food and was awesome! Word to the wise, if you ask for spicy, you'll get spicy, so be careful! Recommend to anyone

Was staying at the Hostel Cat across the street and needed some food before we started drinking haha... 

Decided to give this place a shot and it got the job done. The price was affordable and it came out of the kitchen right off the stove.

I've had Thai food before and this was more Chinese than Thai. Overall it was ok, but not anything great.
Big space. Lots of parking. Close to the strip but off the beaten path. The waitress was sweet. The food is standard. Lunch specials are a good deal.
Ocha is a solid Thai option in the Downtown area of Las Vegas.  I did delivery option and they came when they said in 45 minutes, food was hot, tasty, and reasonably priced.
Solid choice for the price range! service was on point! and definitely understand why this place has such good rating!

Quick and affordable take out. The best dishes aren't necessarily the more popular ones. The wild hog with peppercorns was positively delicious and far more authentic than the dishes other people ordered. We all shared though and most of it was good overall. If you even think about trying the Beef jerky, do it. The texture is perfect, with just enough crisp exterior and a terrific savory sauce on the side. I would happily give them four stars were it not for the broccoli with crispy pork. Almost inedible, the crispy pork bits were painfully dry and devoid of flavor. The broccoli itself was fine, but also lacked flavor. Ultimately we hardly touched it and, if there, would have sent it back.

My mom is Thai and a WONDERFUL cook. It just doesn't get any better than her home cooking. I've lived in Los Angeles all my life and have yet to find good Thai food. There's some okay places, but nothing comes close to her food. 

Until I stumbled upon Ocho a few years ago on a Girls' Vegas Weekend. It's now become a ritual with friends and family. Everyone that I've ever taken to Ocho has made it their Vegas ritual also. I love fine dining and will spend lots of money for good food and a fancy ambiance. But Ocho is more of a dive. Nothing fancy about it at all. Last time I was there, a lady was shredding papaya for the papaya salad at a table near us...just like my mom would. I've tried many items on their menu and have been very happy. But I highly recommend the beef jerky, spicy seafood soup and larb. They also stay open very late..until 4am. Which is great after the clubs.

Headed to Vegas this spring and it is a must on our list aside from all the fancy restaurants I like to patron.
Love this place, the service is great and so is the food! This is my go to spot for Thai food! We got the pad see ew, beef jerky, mint chicken and shrimp with chili sauce. We loved it all.
Been craving their crispy won tons so had to come back. Friendly staff, fast service and most importantly great food at great prices!

Best thai coffee with milk ever! Came here with my friend who is obsessed with this place. She recommended me to get num tok which means beef waterfall (eh?) sounds weird but it's so bomb! Tasted like Korean BBq meat with some unique spices to it. This place is small and super Asian and delicious. 

I know it's not a high end restaurant like others on the strip but it's so worth it. Hurrayyy for cheap food :]

I am very spoiled by the tasty Thai food in Seattle and I found the Thai portion of our meal (pad thai)  to be....eh....not memorable.  The fried rice (or as you will see on the menu "fired rice" was tasty as hell though and I cleaned shop on that plate.  Very cheap and fun atmosphere (I peeked and saw a room full of older Asian women gambling in a room in the back--so cute).  However, I was a bit turned off when they brought me a glass that still had lipstick marks from a previous customer on it.  :/

Still very good authentic Thai food in Vegas....although I have a new favorite!

My friends love the "large" thai teas...which are huge!  They have to be like 32oz of yummy or close to it....and cheap!  I think they were about $3!

We usually order pad ka pao and pad kee mao, as hot as they will make it.  The curry is also very good here, but not my fav Panang curry.

The location could use a refresher...showing it's age...and the location sucks...

But the food is why you come here!  And it will be worth the trip!
Great food and great servers.  We will be back. Great place for birthday dinner and friends gathering
The Mongolian beef is great. Different than any other I've tried. Service is quick and friendly.

Stopped in on a recent trip to Las Vegas when we were craving Thai food for lunch, but the food was only so so. 

Crab papaya salad was okay but a bit too sour. The Pad Thai was greasy and  strange tasting. BBQ beef was tough and lacked flavor. The accompanying sauce was tasty, but with the beef so chewy, that made it all the more disappointing. 

The restaurant - adjacent to a motel on the Boulevard beyond the end of the Strip - is clean and has ample parking. The service was okay, a bit slow but no complaints there. 

Maybe I am spoiled because I live near Thai Town in Los Angeles and there is a LOT of good Thai food nearby. I might eat at Ocha again if I were craving Thai when in Las Vegas, but this visit was not really satisfying especially when compared to what I am used to.

Ocha is a fantastic Thai restaurant!  I have eaten there over 10 times and the experience is always amazing.  My favorite dishes are the chicken basil and deep fried hen.  Check it out and you won't be disappointed!

This may be a family owned restaurant and I just see 2 workers here, an old man and an old lady.

The nicer the old man is, the meaner the old lady is. She doesn't even laugh or smile.

We had a bad experience with her. She took our orders, we already known that the Thai Ice Tea is sweet and we ask for the less sweet Thai Ice Tea. She just makes sweet. I asked for combination fried rice but changed immediately as I just noticed the Hawaii fried rice. She mumbled. My friend asked for a shrimp curry but she wants to change right after that. The old lady mumbled again. Then she kept mumbling after and after that which we don't even know.

As the coffee is too sweet, we want the blank dark coffee to dilute the coffee. The lady kept asking what is it? Ice or hot? She came back and the old man brought us a hot black coffee. Later on, the lady brought another ice coffee but as she figured out we already had one, she brought it back and ....drank it!!!!!!!!

We paid for the food, she just left our bill right there on the cashier table and take care of the other customers first. So it's take us like 15-20mins to have our bill done.

All of the food is not as good as they used to be, or maybe she doesn't want us to have a good food. Hawaii fried rice is the only one that we could eat. Green and red curry are so salty, the shrimp is tasteless.

I don't want to leave them a low amount of star because they are like my mom and dad who doesn't speak English well, so they can't serve well. I just write my own review here so if the owner can read, they can improve it.

Above all, this restaurant is right to the opposite side of the street next to Catrosphere, so if you don't like the breakfast in the restroom, you can try it here. You may have a better luck than us!
Some of the best Thai food I've ever had, here or abroad.  I always try to set aside time whenever I am in Vegas to stop by this small, family-owned joint for some authentic Thai cuisine.
I'm really not sure what everyone is raving about... We got quite a few items and they were all completely tasteless and/or tasted old. So disappointed!

This is very legit authentic Thai food place. The papaya salad was right on the money. Oh n don't order Thai Hot if u r not prepare to go into a spicy comma. I love it, I just wish I would just do regular hot.
Really good Thai food! Pad Thai and larb chicken is flavorful and portion size is great for the price. Service was excellent as well. Checks all the boxes for a five star place!
Still nothing comes close to this place. Still our favorite Thai Restaurant here in Vegas. They have great food and the best service crew (Gammie, Judy). Definitely need more places like this one.

The service is very slow and poor. It took over 15 minutes to even get plates to serve ourselves. How is it logical to bring out the food before plates??? After eating, it then took them about 10 minutes to bring out the check. Don't know why it took them so long?! Food was ok, establishment was clean, and they have free wifi.

This is my favorite Thai restaurant in town! 
Their Thai Beef Jerky is seriously finger licking good!
I've tried so many different things at this restaurant and all of them were great!

This place was awesome! I like authentic thai food with a great kick to it. The restaurant was spacious it is great for families and large groups. The restaurant was cognizant that the Stanley Cup Finals were on and he put up a projector showing the game.

There is a karaoke machine there with a gentleman playing the guitar too. I liked that there was sufficient parking for my group too.

I'm relatively new to Vegas and I met the owner, Note, at a Japanese restaurant in Chinatown last month. He told me about the place and took care of our group. Service was excellent. Note came to the restaurant after he found out I was bringing my friends that were anime fans and he treated me with some drinks and he joined us for some conversation. 

Overall customer service was excellent and food was excellent. I recommend the penang curry. The chef did a great job with it.

The restaurant has improved by a boatload, the food is worth every penny and the owner Note is such a good restaurant owner with a lot to offer, i will be coming back for many foodie adventures to come!!

Ordered the staple Chicken Pad Thai. The food came out in under 5 minutes. Adding I am here at 5 pm, which is not during the lunch or dinner spacials.  The  noodles seemed overcooked and flavor was at par with others Thai restaurants around town.  Descent Thai food but nothing to right home about.
Ocha Thai is our favorite restaurant in Las Vegas, and maybe of all times. Friendly service and a great family tradition. Thank you !!

Chicken tom kha!! Amazing and service is great. The owner note is amazing! 

They have karaoke nights as well and it is very fun.
Chicken Pad Thai level 9 absolutely delicious definitely coming back.  Found this spot just driving down the strip never know what diamond you will find on this 7 mile drive just cruizin.   Thx Ocha

The reviews being highly mixed extremes, either "This place was disgusting" or "This was food of the Gods", my sister and I were a little hesitant to eat here. We decided to give it a shot anyway on our last day in town. I'm so glad we did!
The place was pretty empty, only two or three other tables were filled. I asked about this during the meal and apparently they had a location shift, only to find this part of town had very little diner traffic. Despite the cavern-like emptiness it was clean and well-kept, with warm lighting and an overhead tv with the news signifying the dining area in use.

Our waiter was young, personable and enthusiastic, happy to answer questions with descriptive answers, and checked in on us often. The manager at the counter was pleasant as well, and halfway through our meal asked about our experience personally.

The thai iced tea was FABULOUS, delicious and refreshing. It paired well with all the dishes. I ordered the Tom Kha soup, Thai Beef Jerky, and Fried Wontons to share. My sister had the Chinese fare, Kung Pao chicken (no spice) and Egg Drop Soup.
We received the wontons first. They were a little transluscent and crispy-crunchy brown, a little greasy but in a good way. There wasn't as much of the yummy sausage-y meat in each one as I would have liked, but it wasn't a big deal. The sweet chili sauce served with these had no heat/spiciness at all, which was great for my sister's cat tongue.

Next we got the Thai beef jerky, the Kung Pao, and Tom Kha soup. My soup was on fire! Rather, the beautiful metal tureen it was in had flames coming from the center, which was both fun and kept the soup hot throughout the meal. There was enough soup to feed 4 people, which was great as I was wondering why it was $10 alone. The Tom Kha is offered in chicken or shrimp and has a coconut, chili,  and lime base. It was rich and clean, sour at first sip before bursting with flavor, absorbed well by the tender white-meat chicken. 

The beef jerky is evidently marinated or well-seasoned thick sticks of beef that are quickly deep-fried. The result is a crispy yet jerky-like outside and a tender inside. I'm not sure what the greenish dipping sauce was, but it pairs perfectly with the jerky. I was a big fan of this dish, as was my sister and our family ravaged the leftovers. 

Sister's Kung Pao was very good, I'm not too familiar with the dish and something tells me it wasn't like most dishes of the same name, but names aside the meat was nicely done, the sauce delectable, and always a pleasant surprise the vegetables were perfectly done, not mushy or hard, just a perfect little crunch to it. 
The Egg Drop came about a minute after the rest and was an enticing rich gold-brown, not the typical glutenous neon yellow. Sister loved it. We were also offered a tureen of white rice, which was perfect as well.

The check came out to about $48-$50 (before tip), with the Kung Pao and Tom Kha being the $10 dishes, the jerky and wonton appetizers about $8 and $6 each, egg drop $5, and drinks $2-ish, then tax. The portion sizes were good for the price. I typically don't pay more than $15 for a meal, but I feel extremely satisfied with my experience, and can't wait to visit again next time I'm in Vegas!

my shrimp fried rice was good while other things were questionable... 

we ordered the stuffed chicken wings to start~ i was soooo excited but it was served still iced cold at the core.. so yup we sent it back to the kitchen and they were happy to re-do it for us~  2nd batch returned scorching hot.. NAILED IT! lol

other than that mishap, the dining experience was alright.  the waiter was all smile which was nice.  you'd be surprised how big of a difference that makes.

anyway, i'm not really looking to return, but hey, if i'm in the area and it's a convenient spot to get to-- i might give them another try.
The best Thai food place in Las Vegas!! I love all the food, customer service is so great as well!!! My favorite spot in town.

I eat here every couple of weeks as it is in the rotation.  My menu selection is limited though as I typically eat something off the lunch special menu, the beef salad with steamed rice, or the meatball soup depending on the weather.  The staff is quick and helpful.

I think this place intentionally tried to make this a bad experience.  I did everything possible to stay positive and give this place a fair shake.  How would you rate a place based on this?

1. I find this place on Yelp and I go to the address and they have a small sign on the door that says they moved.  The owners did not update any listings on-line!  The only thing they did was take a piece of copy paper and hand write a little note and tape it to the door.  DUHHHHH.

2.  No greeting upon entering.  Some slobish looking guy sitting at the register waved some one down to sit me.  I wouldn't be surprised if this was the owner - it would make perfect sense.  Imagine, Barney from the Simpson's greeting your customers.

3.  Super long wait for the food.  I ordered a simple chicken curry.  I was in no hurry for my curry, but the 30 minute wait for food was getting to me.
