4.  So by the time I get my food, I am starving.  I dive right into my bamboo shoot curry....  errr.... chicken curry and burned my mouth.  Maybe that was my fault, but it hurt like a mother effer!

5.  The food.  Well it was not good.  It was a bowl of bamboo shoots with a few pieces of chicken.  The curry was greasy, it was like gravy or something.  I thought green curry sauce was supposed to have a coconut flavor.  Anyways, I could hardly taste anything anyways after my mouth was burned.  I can say this, for the better part of 2 days I had a terrible after taste from this place.  

6.  I get my bill.  These people had the nerve to charge me a $1 for rice, even though the menu says rice is included.  So it was $8.95 plus a $1.  Who charges for rice?  That really pissed me off! 

I got your one star review for your one dollar rice!
Go here almost every week for fried rice yum yum! Great portions and always steaming hot.

The beef jerky and sticky rice are my favorites but everything I have had is good.   Ok, it is not the best atmosphere but to me this adds to the experience.  Just wish there was more parking.


12/15/13 not sure what is going on.. The place was dead, the food was not as good and the prices when up. Not my favorite place anymore.

I'm a fan of Ochoa in LA.  Nothing here is good.  Everything is sweet.  Panang curry is sweet, barely had any curry flavor.  Pad Thai, chicken satay, stuffed wings, chow mein Sweeeeet.   Will not be back.

This is one of those dirty places that you see in the movies about scene kids in New York or LA. You walk in and the staff immediately greets you as if you are part of their family and cannot wait to get you fed. I think that the interior might be off-putting to some, but all I can say to those people is that they really need to travel more if they think this place is dingy. The tom kha gai soup is amazing and they will make it to varying intensities of spiciness so that you enjoy it to its fullest. I have had many dishes here and think that they are exceptionally good, especially when compared to other Thai restaurants in this town. I hope that everyone has a chance to experience this diamond-in-the-rough restaurant.

Cost: $11 (without tip) 

Close place to where I live (Hostel Cat). Also near two wedding chapels, many cheap motels and a couple of adult stores. I'm not implying anything. 

I ordered the Pad Thai, as most people to a new Thai place do. The rebel in me chose the shrimp over the chicken.

Interior is nicely decorated but simplistic. Feels a bit on the posh side. There's even a stage where a lady was singing Thai songs, karaoke-style. 

Pad Thai arrived with a whole lot of chilli flakes/powder sprinkled on top to make it spicy - this could be improved. 
The taste was typical and the noodles were greasy enough to not feel dry as they do in some other places. 
However, no lime wedge was provided and flavour could have been richer. 

I probably should have gone with the Tom Yum Goong. 

Would come again if I'm the mood for Thai.

I can't believe I missed this place the whole time I've been living here!  I came here pretty late after work and they were still open.  I think I just found my late night go to spot when I get off late :-)

I always order the Pad Thai first at any Thai restaurant because if that's good, then everything else is good.  The Pad Thai was GOOD.  Very savory and not over-cooked and soggy.  Next, I think I will try the Pad See Yew (looks really tasty in the pictures).

Great food. Ocha is in a quirky non-assuming location. Their Pad Thai (usually the bar for evaluating Thai restaurants) is good and the Beef Salad (ordered medium spicy) was unique and refreshing. I believe this is indicative of their salad dishes in general so be sure not to miss this. They also have some standard Chinese dishes on the menu (Kung Pao chicken was good). Our group left full and satisfied.  Overall, it was delicious meal and price and is a good alternative to a buffet for a lighter yet satisfying meal.
Me and the wifey riding around on the strip and we come across this lil gem called Ocha, delicious!

If I could give this place no stars i would. The service sucks and the food is never the same. This is the McDonald's of all Thai food. If your looking for plain and below average taste well here's the place for you.

Came here for the first time from a recommendation of a friend.  We were greeted and sat down immediately.  We met the owner/manager named Note.  He is such a friendly guy who gave us great service and good recommendations.  For starters we ordered the beef jerky at the recommendation of Note.  It was very good.  The only downside to the jerky is that it had alot of fat on it.  My husband ordered  the red curry chicken which is thoroughly enjoyed.  I ordered the chicken with mint and the thai papaya salad with sticky rice at the recommendation of other yelpers.  I've never had the papaya salad but enjoyed it.  I think next time I will have the dried shrimp omitted possibly. We always got refills on our beverages.  You can count we will be back and try some other dishes.  Can't wait!

Perhaps the best catfish Thai green curry I have ever had, well it's the first catfish Thai green curry I've ever had! Lol. I won't be ordering the seafood or chicken option again, that's how good this was. Lol. The restaurant owner, Notc even greeted me and introduced himself. The waitress, also very sweet and personable. I'll recommend Ocha everytime. It was like eating at their house. Go!

Decent price, authentic and a chance of trying different thai desserts are what makes this place a gem in Vegas.  Screw finding a thai restaurant in the casinos, just take a hike towards Stratosphere and give them a try.  Their spicy prawn soup is nice and spicy and soury(sp?) and their curries are delicious.  If you're lucky they might have a sticky rice and mango serviing or two for you...order more than necessary cause its pretty cheap and really tasty.  Wait why are you reading this review?  Aren't you suppose to be going to vegas to gamble and party allll night long and wait in long lines for a seafood brunch buffet or something?

Changed ownership and very disappointed. All the food is different, and not as good. This used to be my go to place 1-2 times a week. Now I won't be returning. Actually very sad as I had built relationships with the previous staff as well. I guess it happens though

Recommendation from a friend, we went to Ocha for dinner. This is a little place near Stratosphere casino. Plenty of parking, the restaurant was clean with karaoke set up but no one was singing at the time. We ordered pad thai, beef jerky, and papaya salad. The foods were good and service was ok. Overall, it was a good experience and we would come back again.
Fast and Friendly service. Food was simply, okay.
Great food and the service is fast and polite. They are remodeling currently and it looks great. The Thai Iced Coffee is a must try. They also have a good lunch special.
Yummm panang...great place for lunch downtown! Great price, crave the food, friendly staff!

We absolutely love Ocha, we have been coming here for years & we are very happy that the authenticity of Thai food has been brought back. We are not meat eaters so the fact that they have a variety of vegetarian dishes are great!!

I don't think this place deserves four stars. My friend took us here for lunch and I thought the food was just average. The chicken panang curry was just ok,nothing special. The crab papaya salad was too salty. We asked the waiter for a whole catfish fried or BBQ, I think he wasn't listening because what we got were deep-fried cut up catfish filets. When we told him we wanted a whole catfish not filets, he said they only had filets. WTH?? The only saving grace was the Tom yum soup and combination fried rice.  Those very great.

SUPER friendly people!!! Came about an hour before closing on a Saturday night and they still were able to take my take out order. Ordered a pad see ew and a side of rice after a long day on the strip. Totally fulfilling and it was enough to feed me and another friend. Thai tea was ace but there was just a little too much ice. Also, the check in offer is only good for dine in customers. 

Definitely coming back here during my next trip to Vegas!

Ocha is a solid thai restaurant and a great option for lunch. I`ve been coming here since they were located inside an ugly motel a couple of blocks down the strip. Their new location is light years better. 

Most things remains the same, including the hilarious guy who is always pissed off at something -or someone, and gives you shitty looks. The food is also pretty consistent. Lunch specials never fail. For $6.95 you can order a delicious pad thai with white rice and a spring roll. Portions are pretty big, except maybe for Kung Pao Chicken -great option too!-.

As a person that has tried almost all lunch specials, I `ve to say that you cannot go wrong with any. Tom Kha Kai is well made and seasoned. Same goes for curries and fried rice. 

Since Thai BBQ closed several months ago, Ocha is the best thai option in that part of downtown.

Great place, excellent customer service!!! 
Food is so authentic and fresh!!!
Order the stuffed chicken wings, you won't be sorry!!! 
Definitely going to be a regular spot for me!

i believe my favorite/usual is a side order, but who cares? no one said you had to order an entree. haha. beef jerky with sticky rice! the sauce it comes with is unreal. i'm not from vegas, but i crave it often. on my vaca i sometimes get it more than twice! so yummy!  

they have other great dishes like the panang curry, chicken something (it has all these veggies and bamboo shoot) and even their fried rice .. i just can't remember them at the moment, but i suggest that you check this place out if you like thai food.  the staff are very friendly too!

*REMEMBER TO ORDER THAI TEA!
very helpful and accommodating when it comes to deliveries. great menu selection. food was delicious. will order with them again in the future
